loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nadra

texts.en:
Nadra is a milk seller by profession. She sells milk in her community. She has been selling milk along with her husband for many years. Her husband sells milk in nearby towns and she sells in her neighborhood. In this way, both contribute income for the household expenses.
 
Nadra is age 40 and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Day by day, the needs of her family are increasing but her source of income still remains constant..Therefore, Nadra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy an additional cow for the production of milk, yogurt, butter and cheese.  Nadra thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow

loans.name: Sopey Dabakh Group

texts.fr: SOPEY DABAKH  est un groupement composé de 14 personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et se réunissent tous les 15 jours. La présidente du groupe s’appelle GADE, et elles sont à leur 1er prêt. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation des produits cosmétiques et d’autres produits divers. Elle a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. GADE sollicite ce montant pour acheter des  produits cosmétiques telles que les laits de corps, des greffages, les vernis pour les ongles etc.……en tant  que chef de groupe elle se lève  à 6h du matin pour vaguer à ses occupations et donner le bon exemple aux autres. Elle voudrait aussi à l’avenir diversifier ses produits et augmenter ses  revenus. Elle veut aussi avoir un grand magasin de luxe.
texts.en:
Sopey Dabakh is a group made up of 14 people who live in the same neighborhood and get together every two weeks. They are seeking their first loan.

The group's president is named Gade. Her field of business is selling cosmetics and other various products. She has more than five years of experience in this field.

Gade is seeking this loan to buy cosmetics, such as body milk, hair extensions, nail polish, etc.

As the group leader, she wakes up at 6 a.m. to attend to her affairs and set an example for the others.

In the future, she would like to diversify her product offering and increase her income. She also wants to have a luxury department store.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, such as body milk, hair extensions, nail polish, etc

loans.name: Sector Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SECTOR NORTE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elena es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, macramé en mantillas, venta de humintas, venta de comida, tejido de fajas, tienda de barrio, compra y venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elena es integrante, ella indica que es la dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años cuando empezó a convivir con su esposo quien trabajaba en el mismo rubro.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen esta auncente una socia, l que se tuvo que marchar por razones de trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank “SECTOR NORTE” will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi regional office. It is comprised of eight members and led by a board of directors with Elena serving as president. The members carry out a variety of business activities such as blanket knitting, macramé shawl knitting, tamale sales, food sales, belt weaving, livestock purchase and sales, and running a neighborhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs such as the member Elena. She says that joined Pro Mujer two years ago by invitation from a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently, Elena has a business of knitting and selling blankets. She says that she learned this trade several years ago when she started living with her husband who is in the same line of work.

The loan that she will take out is to buy wool which she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz. She will subsequently make her products and sell them by order. This form of work allows her to earn an income to support her family since she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that the likes the training that the institution offers. 

One member is absent in the above photo: she had to leave due to work-related reasons.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna, es acompañada, vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijas, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar se dedica a vender verduras de forma independiente, lo hace todos los días, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia, ya tiene 4 años de experiencia en su negocio por lo que no tiene ninguna dificultad en realizarlo.
En estas fechas de fin de año las ventas de verduras aumentan por lo que solicita un crédito para  surtir su negocio invertirá en la compra de ejotes, tomates, repollos, cebollas, papas, entre otras clases de verduras, con las que podrá mejorar sus ventas y su economía será más estable.
Aspira a ver a sus hijas como profesionales y comprar una terreno para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Johanna is in a relationship and she lives with her partner and their daughters.  She sells vegetables independently to help with the household expenses.  She does this every day; she learned the business from her family and she already has four years of experience with her business, which is why she has no trouble with it. 

Around this time at the end of the year vegetable sales increase, which is why she is asking for a loan to stock her business.  She will buy green beans, tomatoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes, among other kinds of vegetables, which will allow her to increase her sales and make her finances more stable.  

She hopes to see her daughters become professionals and to buy some land to build a house.

loans.use: to buy green beans, tomatoes, cabbages, onions, and potatoes, among others

loans.name: Diewo

texts.fr:
Créé le 17 Mai 2007 à l’inauguration du banc villageois, ce groupe est composé de femmes qui ont une expérience dans le programme des bancs villageois. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et partageant des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, la transformation de produits locaux et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Diéwo est une femme très entreprenante, elle est mariée, âgée de 41 ans et mère de huit enfants dont cinq garçons et trois filles. Elle fait de la transformation de patte d’arachide. Elle achète des sacs d’arachide non décortiqués auprès des producteurs, fait le transport et la transformation au marché de la commune. Cette activité elle la pratique de plus d’une dizaine d’année.

Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter au moins 10 sacs pour son premier voyage pour transformation, puis vente au prix moyen de 15 000 F CFA le seau de 20 Kg.

Avec les bénéfices, elle pense assurer la couverture médicale des enfants et faire face aux charges scolaires de ces mêmes enfants.
texts.en:
Established on May 17, 2007, when the Banc Villageois was inaugurated, this group is made up of women who have experience with the Banc Villageois program.

They all come from the same village, and are tied by strong bonds of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main business is retail, transformation of local products, and rainfall agriculture.

Mrs. Diéwo is a very proactive woman. She's 41 years old, married, and the mother of eight children: five boys and three girls. She transforms peanuts into peanut paste.

She buys unshelled peanuts from producers, transport them, and transform them at her village's market. She's been running this business for more than ten years.

With this new loan, she intends to buy at least 10 sacks on her first trip. After transformation, she will sell them for XOF 15'000 (ca US$ 31) for one 20kg bucket. 

With her profits, she reckons she will be able to cover her children's healthcare and school expenses.

loans.use: to buy at least ten sacks of unshelled peanuts

loans.name: Gervacio

texts.es:
Don Gervacio de 48 años de edad, es padre de cuatro niños con edades de 11, 6, 5 años de edad, además tiene un niño recién nacido hace 15 días, vive con su esposa con quien se acompañó hace siete años aproximadamente. Él se creció solo con su madre pues su padre no lo reconoció,  así que tuvo que trabajar desde pequeño en la agricultura y no tuvo la oportunidad de ir a la escuela, pues trabajaba para la familia.
Trabaja en la agricultura (siembra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo), desde que tenía siete años de edad su padre de crianza le enseño el engorde y destazo de cerdos, al cual se dedica desde entonces lo hace regularmente de cuatro a tres veces al mes, dependiendo de las ventas, también trabaja de jornal ayudando a los vecinos a trabajar en la agricultura y actividades varias. En el destazo le ayuda su esposa y el sale a vender a la comunidad.
Trabaja todos los días desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde regularmente en la agricultura.
Solicita un crédito en credicampo, para la compra de madera, pues necesita construir su pequeña casa de bahareque, pues donde vive actualmente es alquilado y necesita darle a su familia una vivienda.
Sueña con crecer a sus hijos y darles una educación, para que sean personas más preparadas y que puedan desarrollar mejores condiciones de vida.
El crédito le ayudara de mucho porque así, podrá iniciar la construcción de una vivienda más digna y ya no tener que pagar alquiler, con los pequeños ahorros de las ganancias piensa ir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Gervacio is 48 years old; he is the father of four children who are 11, 6, and 5 years old, as well as a 15-day-old newborn.  He lives with his wife, whom he has been with for approximately seven years.  He was only raised by his mother as his father never recognized him, so he had to work in farming as a child and he did not have the opportunity to go to school because he was working for his family.  

He has been working in farming (he grows corn, beans, and sorghum) since he was seven years old.  His father figure taught him how to fatten and butcher pigs, which he has done since; he does it regularly, from three to four times a month depending on sales.  He also works as a laborer, helping his neighbors with farm work and other kinds of businesses.  His wife helps him with the butchering and he goes out and sells to the community.  

He works in farming regularly every day from six in the morning until five in the evening 

He is asking for a loan to buy wood because he needs to build a small wattle-and-daub house as he rents where he currently lives and he needs to provide his family with a home.  

He dreams of raising his children and providing them with an education so they can be better-prepared people who can have better living conditions.

The loan will help him a lot because it will allow him to start construction on a more dignified home and he will no longer have to pay rent.  With the little he has saved from his earnings he plants to improve his house as he goes along.

loans.use: to buy wood, as he needs to build a small wattle-and-daub house

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha es una mujer de 31 años, soltera, su negocio es la elaboración de artesanía en bambú desde hace 8 años. Sus productos los comercializa en el mercado de Masaya y el mercado oriental de  Managua. Actualmente tiene a una persona que le ayuda a la elaboración del producto. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales para el negocio compra de varas de bambú, pintura, transporte.
texts.en: Martha, 31, is single and has been in business making bamboo crafts for eight years.  She sells her products at the Masaya Market and the east market in Managua.  She currently has one person helping her make the products.  The loan she is requesting is to buy materials such as bamboo sticks and paint, and to pay for transportation.

loans.use: To buy bamboo sticks and paint, and to pay for transportation.

loans.name: Omar Arseni

texts.es:
Omar es un joven soltero de 27 años, vive con sus padres en Libertad del Toachi, un pueblito que pertenece a Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector turístico y muy visitado por sus balnearios y comida típica.
Omar es conocido en el sector como el joven de las mil habilidades ya que cuenta con taller de enderezada y pintura, también se dedica a la cerrajería y a veces realiza trabajo de mecánica.
Omar es muy dedicado a su trabajo, es responsable en las entregas; su fuerte es elaborar ventanas y puertas y también se encarga de pintar autos, tiene un pequeño taller único en el sector.
Con el crédito que la institución le pudo otorgar podrá comprar máquinas y más materiales necesarios para el negocio, con ello mejorarán sus ventas y podrá atraer mayor clientela. Se siente muy agradecido con Fundación Alternativa y el proyecto Kiva por esta gran ayuda que le han dado.
texts.en:
Omar is a single young man of 27 who lives with his parents in Libertad del Toachi, a small town that belongs to Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is a tourist area that is very popular for is beaches and typical food.  

Omar is known in the area as the man with a thousand skills, as he has a body work and paint shop and he also works in locksmithing and sometimes does mechanic work.  

Omar is very dedicated to his work; he is responsible about his jobs.  His specialty is making windows and doors and he also does auto paint.  He has a small workshop, which is the only one in the neighborhood.  

With the loan the institution was able to give him he will buy machines and more materials he needs for his business.  This will improve his sales and he will be able to attract more customers.  He is very thankful to Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the wonderful help they have given him.

loans.use: to buy machines and materials he needs for his business

loans.name: Las Cubanitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CUBANITAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, servicio de punto de llamadas, tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de deportivos, tienda de barrio, venta de jugos, venta de dulces, tienda de cotillones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos de contar con un lugar de compras.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, conservas) que adquirirá de las comerciantes mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS CUBANITAS" will begin its sixth Pro Mujer loan cycle at the Social Center of Los Andes.  The group comprises nine members whose board of directors is chaired by Felipa.  The members have different business activities including fruit sales, telephone call center, blanket weaving, clothing sales, sportswear sales, grocery store, juice sales, sweets sales and party store.

The loan they are requesting will benefit small business owners, such as Felipa.  She says she joined Pro Mujer two years ago by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She  currently runs a neighborhood grocery store which she began when she observed that her neighbors needed a place to shop.

She will use the loan as work capital to buy rice, oil and canned goods from wholesale dealers to sell at her store.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is single and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says it is the health and training areas offered at the institution.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil and canned goods.

loans.name: Tarpuy Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Tarpuy” está conformada por 11 socias responsables y trabajadoras que mejoran cada día. Mirian de 39 años es casada y tiene 03 hijos 02 de ellos aún dependientes. Con los deseos de apoyar a su hogar y de contar con un negocio propio Mirian toma la decisión de emprender su negocio de venta de frutas, la cual lo realiza ambulatoriamente. Se siente orgullosa pues gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Su último crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de frutas como manzana, mandarina, plátanos, uvas, entre otros. El deseo de Mirian es de ver realizados profesionalmente a sus hijos. El grupo “Tarpuy” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito.  Mirian es la tercera del lado derecho,  viste polo y chompa color lila.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Tarpuy" is comprised of 11 responsible, hard-working members who improve day by day.  Mirian, 39, is married and has three children, two of which are still in her care.  In an effort to support her household and have her own business, Mirian decided to start a fruit selling business which she does as a street vendor.  She is proud of the fact that she is able to give her family a better quality of life through her hard work.

The loan she requests is to buy fruits such as apples, tangerines, bananas, grapes, etc.  Mirian's desire is to see her children become professionals.  The "Tarpuy" group is grateful to the people who make this loan possible.  Mirian is the third from the right dressed in a lavender top and sweater.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as apples, tangerines, bananas and grapes.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
Carmen vive en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho, tiene 3 hijos a los cuales quiere mucho y por ello trabaja muy duro en su pequeño negocio de venta de especerías, condimentos y abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien porque es muy amable con sus clientes.

Carmen esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá  comprar más insumos, como aji panca al por mayor, palillo, achiote, entre otros y de esta manera seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener un minimarket”.
texts.en:
Carmen lives in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho.  She has three children who she loves very much and works for in her small spice, seasonings and grocery business.  She works around nine hours a day and believes business is going well because she is kind to customers.

Carmen is grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to your support she can buy goods such as wholesale red pepper, turmeric, annatto, etc. and continue working toward her great dream: "To have a minimarket.".

loans.use: To buy goods such as wholesale red pepper, turmeric, annatto, etc.

loans.name: Roger Aurelio

texts.es:
Roger Aurelio tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, una comunidad que se encuentra sobre el valle de Zaña que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura principalmente cultivo de caña de azúcar y algodón, ubicado a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la venta de piqueos y bebidas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable por los exquisitos platos que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de diversos tipos de pescado para la preparación de sus piqueos y cerveza y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Roger Aurelio, 36, lives with his parents in the district of Cayalti, a communicated dedicated to agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the Zaña Valley which has allowed the area to develop around, mainly, sugar cane and cotton cultivation.  It is an hour and twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

He sells food and beverages in his business located at home.  He has a considerable number of customers because of the exquisite dishes he offers.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,500 PEN to buy different kinds of fish for his dishes and beer.  This will generate more income for his family.

loans.use: To buy different types of fish and beverages.

loans.name: Julia Armida

texts.es:
Julia de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, esta casado, su pareja se dedica en un taller de reparaciones de llantas, han procreado 6 hijos, de las cuales 4 están con ellos y solo están estudiando 2.

Ella junto a su esposo, poseen un taller de reparaciones de llantas desde hace 4 años, su esposo que fue el de la iniciativa, juntos administran el taller, el cual les está yendo bien. Antes se dedicaban a la carpintería, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, tanto sus hijos como su esposo trabajan en el taller; por lo que no gasta en mano de obra. 

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar llantas para moto; ya que han visto una oportunidad de ganancia, debido a que es muy solicitado ese producto, con lo que espera atender otro tipo de clientes.

Su deseo es que el taller siga creciendo aún más,  poder tener el sustento de su familia y que sus hijos se sigan dedicando de lleno a un trabajo digno y sano, con esto ampliara su inventario y las ganancias serán guardadas para ampliar el negocio aún más, porque tienen más sueños a futuro.
texts.en:
Julia is 65, married and has studied up to third grade. Her partner works in a tyre repair workshop. They have 6 children, 4 of whom live with them and only 2 are studying. Julia and her partner have owned a tyre repair workshop for 4 years. It was her husband who started it, and they run it together, and the business is going well. Before that they worked in carpentry. They run the business from their home, and Julia's children and husband work in the repair shop. In this way they don't spend money employing outside workers.

Julia is asking for this loan to buy motorbike tyres, as they have spotted an opportunity to make a profit because there is much demand for this product. For this reason they hope to attract another type of customer. Her dream is that the workshop would continue growing even more, that she could sustain her family and that her children could continue working hard at a dignified and safe job. With the purchase of the tyres she will increase her product range and this will safeguard profits in order to grow the business further, as they have more dreams for the future.

loans.use: to buy motorbike tyres as there is an opportunity to make a profit because there is great demand for this product.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr: TAKKU LIGGEY  est un groupement composé de 10 personnes qui sont toutes des femmes et habitent dans le même quartier. Elles se réunissent  à chaque fois de besoin. Leur présidente se nomme Blandine, elle est marié et mère de famille. Agée de 46 ans, elle a une expérience de plus de 3ans dans cette activité. Elle évolue dans l’aviculture. Elle sollicite ce montant pour acheter des poussins, les élever et ensuite les revendre. Blandine se reconnait sur la photo par les mains croisées. Elle aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée  à 9h pour la terminer à 15h. A l’avenir elle souhaite grâce à l’aide de l’institution renforcer son fond de roulement afin d’augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Takku Liggey is a group made up of 10 women who live in the same neighborhood. They gather together at each time of need. 

The president is named Blandine; she is married and the mother of a family. Blandine is 46 years old and has been in business for more than 3 years. She is in the poultry business. She is requesting this amount to purchase chicks, which she will then raise and resell. She is pictured in the photo with her arms crossed.

Blandine helps her husband with the daily expenses and the schooling costs for her children. She begins her day at 9am and works until 3pm. In the future, Blandine hopes that, with the help of this organization, she will be able to increase her earnings and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase chicks to raise and then resell

loans.name: Adonaïm 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme BINTOU est responsable du groupe ADONAÏM 2. Bintou se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 17 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. Deux(02) vont à l’école et elle a 05 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des combustibles (bois de chauffe) depuis 04ans. Elle se fait livrer à domicile et à Léo (frontière de Ghana). Ses clients sont les femmes.
 Elle veut s’acheter 01camion de bois de chauffe. 
Elle réinvesti ses bénéfices pour agrandir son activité. Mme ambitionne aider son mari pour la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Bintou is the representative of the group Adonaïm 2. Bintou does well for herself. She is married and the mother of 4 children, the oldest of whom is 17 and the youngest of whom is 5. Two of her children attend school and she has 5 people in her care.

Bintou has been selling fuel (firewood) for 4 years. She has it delivered at home and in Léo (the border of Ghana.) Her customers are women. She wants to purchase one truckload of firewood. She will reinvest her profits in order to expand her business. Bintou hopes to help her husband with their children's education.

loans.use: to purchase 1 truckload of firewood

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, es casado y tiene un hijo que ya es independiente, desde hace diez años emprendió su negocio de venta de ropa, esto debido a la necesidad de tener ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, su horario es de 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 p.m., lo hace tres días a la semana, es apoyado por su esposa.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de blusas, camisas, pantalones trajes para niños y vestidos, le servirá para renovar su inventario y tener todo listo para satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes en esta temporada de fin de año, con lo aumentaran sus utilidades y podrá cumplir con los pagos correspondientes a sus deudas.
Sueña con mantener activo su negocio para tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mario's married and has a child who's already independent.  Ten years ago he started his business selling clothing because he needed to have an income to cover the family expenses.  His schedule is 5 a.m. to 3 p.m. three days a week; his wife helps him.

Mario will invest the loan in buying blouses, shirts, pants, children's outfits, and dresses.  This will allow him to update his inventory and have everything ready to satisfy customer demand during this end-of-year season.  His profits will increase and he'll be able to make his loan payments.

He dreams of keeping his business running so he has a better family lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, pants, children's outfits, and dresses

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a very hard working young woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is still single with no children. Regina has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. At present, Regina needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at her own house that neither has piped water nor electricity. 

Joyce has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. She would like to apply for a loan of ksh. 50,000 to buy more stock of rice, biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice, biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en: Nuru appreciates her previous loan that improved her living standards. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of ksh.50,000 to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of biscuits, groundnuts, sweets, soft drinks and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi is 31 years old, married, and lives in the village Vardzia, Kharagauli district. He lives with his wife, 2 children and grandmother. To take care of his family's needs, Giorgi is extensively engaged in agriculture activities, breeding pigs, beekeeping, and cultivating of nuts. He realizes income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. 

Karapet's wife helps him greatly in his everyday activities. However, the income is so insignificant, compared with the needs of family, that they live under the poverty level and get 250 GEL social assistance from the local government. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Giorgi needs a loan of 1300 GEL to buy a milking cow. After the cow is purchased the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They will also use the milk products for family feeding. The new business initiative will give him chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

Giorgi and his family members rely on the good will of the lenders and are thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain his agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow and produce milk products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 46-year-old lady. Her all devotions are for her husband who is earning a very low income. Her husband provides sheltering services for houses under construction. Most of the work depends upon contracts and most of the time he is unable to get any contracts for sheltering services. Recently her husband got a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering materials to provide proper services. Kousar has requested a loan so that her husband will be able to buy more sheltering materials to provide his best services. Kousar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of loan raising.

loans.use: to buy sheltering materials for her husband's sheltering service.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 36-year-old lady. She is a very poor and needy woman. The major problem of her poorness is that her husband has not adopted a profitable business til yet. She is passing her life with her family by hand to mouth. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed the whole family. Due to continuously working, the planks have broken and lost their smoothness, which is why they need to be replaced with new ones. Now her husband is unable to continue his business without smooth planks, wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy sheltering materials for sheltering services provided by her husband.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 38-year-old widow and a mother of three children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. She sews garments of nearest factories (her brother brings cloths from the factory) and for the ladies of her area as well. To help her continue the operations of her business, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine because her previous sewing machine is out of order due to continuous work. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. Najma thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr:
La dame Rokhaya, mariée et mère de quatre enfants, évolue dans le secteur du commerce depuis 2 ans. Elle a été appuyée financièrement par son mari dans le commencement de ses activités. Rokhaya a démarré avec la vente de petit déjeuner. Actuellement, elle vend des denrées alimentaires et possède une cantine dans le marché du quartier. Elle commence sa journée à 10h, prend une pause à 13h et rentre à 19h.Elle n’a pas de charges sinon si elle désire appuyer son mari dans la gestion du foyer, elle peut le faire volontairement sans contrainte.
Grâce aux crédits, elle peut au moins augmenter sa marchandise. Rokhaya souhaiterai voir son activité aller plus de l’avent et que le profit augmente. Elle pourra alors appuyer son unique frère et l’aider à régler quelques besoins.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokhaya is married and the mother of four children. She's been a merchant for the past two years. Her husband supported her financially when she started her business.

At first, Rokhaya sold breakfasts. She now sells food products and owns a small shop in the neighborhood market. She opens at 10 a.m., takes a break at 1 p.m. and goes back home at 7 p.m.

She doesn't have any expenses to cover, but she wants to help her husband to manage the household expenses, voluntarily and without constraints. Thanks to the loans, she can at least increase her stock.

Rokhaya would like to see her business progress and her profits increase. She will then be able to support her only brother and help him take care of his needs.

loans.use: to buy food products to resell

loans.name: Rosa Jazmin

texts.es: Rosa de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, hijo de 7 años, mamá y dos sobrinos. Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta de pan dulce desde hace mucho tiempo. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia, razón por la cual solicita esta crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de la energía eléctrica. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Rosa is 22 years old. She lives in her own home with her life's companion, her 7 year old son, her mother and her two nephews. Rosa has worked buying and selling sweet bread for a long time. In this way, she earns a living and supports her home. She wants to improve her and her family's living conditions. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan by installing electrical wiring. She hopes to be able to have this loan and thus improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to install electric wiring in her house.

loans.name: Kédiaw

texts.fr:
Kédiaw a 49 ans, mariée et malheureusement n’a pas de progéniture. Elle loge à quelques centaines de mètres du guichet et est une cliente fidèle de ce dernier. Elle a déjà fait preuve de son dévouement à son activité à travers IMCEC car à chaque fois qu’elle sent son stock chuter, elle fait recours à la mutuelle. Pour cette fois encore, va acheter de l’huile de palme pour revendre, du poisson séché, et des légumes pour alimenter son étale au marché.
Madame Kédiaw a acquis une expérience de plus de 5 ans et reste active de 8h à 13h au marché, mais vend aussi l’huile de palme chez elle, car elle est bien connu pour la qualité de son produit. Avec les bénéfices de son activité, elle a pu changer son ameublement et mettre un peu d’argent de coté.
Son vœu serait de construire sa propre maison pour pouvoir aider son frère qui est son unique famille et qui n’a pas trop les moyens.
texts.en:
Kédiaw, age 49, is married and, unfortunately, without children. She's a faithful client of UIMCEC, and she lives a few hundred meters from its offices.

She already demonstrated her devotion to her business through UIMCEC, since every time her stock tumbles, she asks UIMCEC for support.

This time again, she will buy palm oil to resell, dried fish, and vegetables to resupply her stall at the market.

Mrs. Kédiaw has more than five years of experience, and stays at the market from 8 a.m. to 1 p.m. She also sells palm oil at her home, because she's very well known for the quality of her products.

With the profits of her business, she was able to get new furniture and put some money away. Her wish is to build her own house to help her brother, who is her only family and who doesn't have much resources.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, dried fish, and vegetables

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya. For the past two years, she has operated a business of selling lesos (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future. With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase 60 pieces of lesos (women's wrap cloths) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 60 pieces of lesos (women's wrap cloths) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, shirts, dresses and underwear for both genders.

loans.name: Kayanja Tusitukirewamu Seed Pjt Group

texts.en:
The group is comprised of 5 members and is located in a rural setting. The members are involved in different activities which include agriculture where they grow maize, beans, passion fruits and matooke (green plantain), beer and soda selling and local brewing.

Charles is a married man aged 49, he lives with his family in a rural area with 14 children, 12 of whom still attend school. He is a farmer who grows  matooke, maize and passion fruit. He is  also a salary earner.

He works 6 days a week and for 8 hours each day. He started his farming  business in 1995 with the purpose of  improving the family’s income. He wants  this loan to pay for the workers on the farm. His clients are people from the surrounding villages and those from the city.

He  hopes that he can  enlarge his business and he also wants to improve on his family’s standard of living. The challenges he faces are pests and diseases which attack the crops and fluctuation of prices. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: to hire labourers to work on the farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, actualmente está acompañada, trabaja el esposo en estructuras metálicas, han procreado tres hijos, solamente  una hija vive con ella, estudia cuarto grado, no vive nadie más con ella.
 
Ella se dedica a vender tamales, lo aprendió de su madre; ya que así las criado a todos sus hermanas, lleva diez años desarrollando la misma actividad; ella los elabora y luego se traslada a la ciudad que está a 2km, se va a las 3 pm y regresa a las 6pm, los hijos le apoyan en el oficio.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar dos recipientes para hervir los tamales, ya que los que tenía no le funcionaban y no puede dejar de producir.

Desea que los clientes que tenga se mantengan y seguir creciendo más en clientes, al comportarse de esta madera el negocio, obtendrá más y mejor ganancia que le sirvan para darle le educación a su hija que tiene.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old. She went to school through the fifth grade. Right now she is in a common law marriage. Her husband works in metallic structures. They have three children. Only one daughter lives with her. She is in the fourth grade, and no one else lives with her.  
 
She works selling tamales. She learned it from her mother, because that was how she raised her and all of her sisters. She has been doing this activity for ten years. She makes them and later transports them to the city which is 2 km away. She goes at 3 p.m. and returns at 6 p.m. Her children help her do this work.

The loan she is asking for is to buy two containers to steam the tamales in. The ones she has aren't working and she can't stop producing. 

She wants to keep the customers she has and keep getting more. By doing this for her business, she will obtain more and better profit which will be used to educate her daughter.

loans.use: to buy two containers to steam tamales in.

loans.name: Amelia Yamileth

texts.es:
Amelia es una joven de 22 años de edad, acompañada y madre de 1 hijo quien tiene 3 añitos de edad y con mucha felicidad por su segundo hijo ya que tiene 3 meses de embarazo. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres tanto financiera mente como moral mente. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar café. Actualmente ella se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar ya que por su embarazo ella no puede ayudar a su compañero de hogar en el campo con las diferentes actividades que se realizan pero si en el hogar. Su compañero de hogar también trabaja en la construcción pero solo cuando hay la oportunidad de hacerlo ya que la prioridad es el cultivo de café. El terreno que su esposo trabaja es propio el cual está ubicado a 500 metros de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se traslada caminando.
Actualmente ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para dar asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de café con los cuales planea sacar una buena cosecha y un grano atractivo para sus clientes.
Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que sus cultivos de café mantengan el follaje y el grano sano ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura. Su sueño es como el de toda madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y lograr enviarlo a la universidad para que él pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que no pase por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud.
texts.en:
Amelia, 22, is a young married woman and the mother of a little one-year-old and of her second child, because she's three months pregnant.  She completed elementary school thanks to her parents, who supported her financially as well as morally.  It was her parents who taught her to grow coffee.

Currently Amelia's a homemaker: she can't help her partner with the various farming tasks because of her pregnancy, but she can help in the home.  Her partner also works in construction but only when there are opportunities, because growing coffee is his priority.  The land her husband works is her own; it's located 500 meters from their home and he walks there.

Currently she has requested a loan from the COMIXMUL cooperative to buy soil amendments, coffee formula, fertilizer, foliars, and other inputs to take care of and protect her coffee crops.  This way she'll get a good harvest and an attractive bean for her customers.

Amelia's plans are to improve and fertilize the land she cultivates so her coffee crops maintain their foliage and healthy bean and they'll be able to have a healthy crop.  Her dream is that of very mother--to support her son in his studies and send him to college so he can graduate and not go through the same situation they did in their childhood.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es: Ana  tiene 36 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su compañero de vida y sus cuatro hijos de 19 años, 16 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. Ana trabaja como empleada doméstica y en sus tiempo libres se dedica a vender antojitos típicos en su hogar de residencia. Desea mejorar las condiciones de las paredes de la vivienda ya que son de bajareque y se encuentran deterioradas. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el material de las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is 36 and lives in very humble conditions together with her life companion and their 4 children ages 19, 16, 14, and 12. Ana works as domestic employee and in her free time she sells typical snacks for a living at her place of residence. She wants to improve the condition of the walls of her home as it made of clay and has deteriorated. Therefore she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to change the material of the walls of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the walls of the house.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is twenty-seven years old. He is living in the southern part of Kosovo in the Ashkali community with his wife and 2 ½-year-old child. Muhamed works as a lumberjack, cutting wood and selling it to others in the community in order to provide heat during the cold weather. He started working in this field a long time ago; however he has now managed to become independent and work for himself. He needs a loan in order to repair  his saw from all of the wear and tear damage it has sustained over time, and he also would like to renovate his workshop where he keeps his saw and cuts his wood. 

The loan will help his work become more effective and efficient and therefore improve his services, which will continue to help his family and give them everything they need. This loan will help to improve his business dramatically and, with the winter months and cold approaching, he will have a higher amount of customer demand and an increase in the need for his services, thereby raising the income for his family. Muhamed hopes to generate more income and secure a better life and education for his child. He appreciates all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To repair  his saw and to renovate the workshop where he keeps his saw and cuts his wood

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children, and she is motivated to provide her family with quality food and to make sure that they are all healthy.

To earn a living, she has been running a small general store with her husband out of their house. She has six years of experience in this field. Her husband purchases stocks of goods from the market because he has developed many contacts over the years.

Parveen is now hoping to grow her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy packs of flour, rice, biscuits, and beverages to meet her customers' increasing demand. She is expecting a boost in her earnings as a result of the loan, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

Note: Parveen is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new state-required smog check machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Renel

texts.en: Renel is currently attending UDABOL working towards his degree in commercial engineering. He expects to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan, he is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Renel shares that it is important for him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Renel plans to use the loan to cover the cost of his graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in commercial engineering before graduating. In addition to his responsibilities at school, Renel currently works 40 hours a week in a warehouse and earns $9 a day. With a career in commercial engineering, he expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. With five older siblings, Renel is unsure how he will be able to afford his graduation fees on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton wants to work in the telecom industry but needs a degree to make it happen. Milton is currently attending the Universidad Mayor de San Andrés, working towards his degree in telecommunications. He plans on graduating in June, 2016 but without a loan from Vittana he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Milton plans on purchasing his much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Milton feels he will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in telecommunications he expects to earn $17 a day. For Milton's family of eight, finances have always been tight. As the youngest of five, with two older siblings attending college already, Milton is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Jack Bill

texts.es:
Jack Bill tiene 32 años de edad vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayalti, ubicado sobre el valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura principalmente al cultivo de caña de azúcar y algodón, comercio y ganadería, a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de alquiler de cabinas y servicio de internet, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, son una familia que se esfuerza en la labor que realizan, Jack ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 200 nuevos soles, para la compra de una computadora y de esta manera abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Jack Bill is 32 years old and lives with his wife in Cayatli district, located in the Valley of Zaña. Locals work in agriculture (more specifically growing sugar cane and cotton), commerce and livestock. This district is located one hour and twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, in Peru’s northern coast.

Jack Bill provides access to computers and to the Internet. His wife helps him; they are a family that works hard. Jack has requested a loan of 4,200 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a computer.

loans.use: to buy a computer for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electricity in his house.

loans.name: Bayasgalan

texts.en:
Bayasgalan, 49, lives with his wife and 4 children in a ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Oyungerel helps her husband to run their family business. His children are under 18 and attend local schools. 

Bayasgalan started his wooden furniture manufacturing business at home a few years ago and now has regular customers. He is popular among the local residents and receives regular orders. He needs additional capital to expand his business by increasing his efficiency and productivity. His brother started helping him and he wants to groom his brother along the way. He is now requesting loan of 2,400,000 MNT to purchase inventories and expand his productivity. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and expand his productivity.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 49-year-old hardworking lady with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is running a retail shop alongside a tea room as her additional income. She is facing challenges of competition and lack of a bigger place for business expansion.

However, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels of learning and building a permanent home. Florence is in need of a loan to add stock of general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to add a stock of general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís de 57 años de edad, proviene de una familia de escasos recurso económicos, motivo por el cual él no asistió a la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ademas le ayuda al trabajo en la agricultura y a la crianza de animales de granja sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y no dependen de él.

 Desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura en el campo, es el trabajo que mejor  aprendió hacer,  ya que es el sustento de su familia, sus tres hijos mayores lo ayudan con el ganado de pasto y con la agricultura el cual les proporcionan los necesario para todos los de la familia; esta actividad la realizan todos los días ya que el cuido de los animales es algo que se tiene que hacer a diario.

 El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto, abonos y fertilizantes para sus tierras para  recoger buenas cosechas  y comercializar a mejores precios dándole esto un buen  resultado e ingresos para toda su familia.
Desea mejora su vivienda ayudara a sus hijos en la educación de sus nietos apoyándolos en todo lo principal y necesario  para  realizarse como padre ,abuelo y esposo dándole un mejor futuro a su familia que día a día crece un poco mas y esto lo lograra por medio de los créditos, ya que con eso él podrá abastecer lo necesario.
texts.en:
57-year old Luís was born into a poor family so he did not attend school. His wife works as a servant and also helps him work the fields and raise animals. Their children are adults and independent. Ever since he was small, Luís has worked in agriculture--it's the job he knows best and provides the money to support his family. His three children help him with the livestock and the crops. They all support their families in this way; they work the land every day and the animals have to be taken care of on a daily basis too.

The loan Luís is seeking is to buy more livestock, as well as manure and fertilizer for the land so he can get good harvests and sell the produce for a good price. This will provide more income for all his family.

He wishes to improve his house, and help his children pay for his grandchildren's education. In other words, as a father, grandfather, and husband he wants to help his family in any way he can to provide them with a better future. The family is expanding, and the loan will help Luís achieve his goals.

loans.use: buy more livestock, as well as manure and fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Pedro José

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre humilde y sencillo de 52 años de edad, 25 de ellos los ha dedicado a trabajar de manera independiente como vendedor ambulante; ofrece café, productos de panadería y cigarrillos, estos artículos los carga sobre su espalda, en un canastillo que puede alcanzar un peso de 20 kilos y así, va caminando por las diferentes calles y barrios del Envigado y Sabaneta; de esta manera se ha ganado la vida para solventar los gastos básicos personales.
El propósito con el crédito es fortalecer su labor y mejorar las condiciones de trabajo, pues comprará un triciclo, más termos e insumos (café, azúcar, vasos desechables, productos de panadería, entre otros); esto le permitirá facilitar el transporte y además aumentará la capacidad de producción para satisfacer la demanda actual que posee y mejorar los ingresos.
Pedro tiene como meta a mediano plazo, acreditar mejor su negocio para ser más competente y poder comenzar a trabajar en otras zonas, así podrá vender mayor cantidad de productos y con los recursos que percibe podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Pedro is a humble and simple man, and is requesting this loan to strengthen his business and to improve his working conditions. 

He is 52 years old and has worked for 25 years as an self-employed street vendor selling goods from place to place. He sells coffee, baked goods and cigarettes, which he carries on his back in a wicker basket – which can weigh up to 20 kilos. He sells his goods walking through the different streets and neighborhoods of Envigado and Sabaneta [municipalities in the Medellín Metropolitan Area]. He earns his living this way and is able to meet his basic personal expenses.

He will buy a tricycle, more thermos containers, and supplies such as coffee, sugar, disposable cups and baked goods. This will make getting from place to place easier for him, and it will also increase his production capacity, so that he can meet his current demand and improve his income.

Pedro’s medium-term goal is to better establish his business’s reputation so that he can be more competitive and start to work in other areas. He hopes to sell a larger quantity of products and to improve his quality of life with the income he receives.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle and thermoses for his business

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in the coastal region of Kenya.

For the past two years, she has operated a motorcycle business.She faces the major challenges of motorcycle breakdown and muddy roads during the rainy season. She dreams of buying a new motorcycle and developing herself.

With the loan of KES 50,0000, she wants to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Xiomara Marisol

texts.es:
Xiomara, está acompañada, vive en una casa familiar junto a sus padres, su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, se dedica a sembrar maíz y pipián, lo hace con el apoyo de su padre, alquilan el terreno para realizar la siembra, en un horario de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 11:30 a.m.
Invertirá en la compra de abono, insecticidas, pesticidas y renta del terreno, con lo que podrá dar tratamiento a su cosecha para luego distribuirlo entre los clientes del mercado, esperar mejorar la calidad de sus productos, mejorar sus ventas y tener una mejor economía.
Aspira a tener un negocio con mejor rentabilidad para construir su propia casa y brindar a su familia un lugar más seguro.
texts.en:
Xiomara is in a relationship. She lives in a family house together with her parents, her life companion, and their 2 children. She grows corn and squash for a living. She does this with the help of her father. They rent the land for planting on a schedule of 6:00 a.m to 11:30 a.m.
She will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide and to rent the land, with which she will be able to treat her harvest to later distribute it among customers in the market. She hopes to improve the quality of her products and her sales to improve her economy.
She aspires to have a business with better profitability in order to construct her own house and provide her family a more secure place.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides and to rent land.

loans.name: Basri

texts.en:
The borrower, Basri, is living in the Ashkali community in Kosovo. He is married and the father of grown children. Basri works as a taxi driver and has been in business for three years, creating a very good reputation for himself and becoming very popular with many people. He has a very polite personality and he works hard to earn a living, which has contributed to his success. 

Even though he is the main source of income for his family, his salary is still quite low and Basri is unable to pay to register his taxi. He is requesting a loan to pay for the registration of the taxi and to purchase new winter tires. This loan will help him to be able to continue with his business and hopefully expand into new lines of transportation in Kosovo and he will continue to work hard to do so. Basri thanks all Kiva lenders for this opportunity!

loans.use: To pay for the registration of the taxi and to purchase new winter tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame Awa, s’active dans le commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 garçons. Elle possède un réfrigérateur qui lui permet de vendre de la glace et de la crème glacée. En plus de cela, elle vend aussi des couvre-lits achetés de la Mauritanie c’est d’ailleurs la raison de ce crédit qu’il sollicite. Elle a une commande de couvre-lits durant cette période de froid.
Awa ne reste pas insouciante face aux besoins du foyer, car elle apporte sa participation dans la dépense, mais aussi s’occupe de l’argent de poche des enfants qui vont à l’école primaire. Elle paie aussi sa ménagère qui vend la crème dans un établissement scolaire.
Awa désire un jour avoir un fond assez suffisant pour ne plus avoir recours aux crédits.
texts.en:
Ms. Awa has been active in commerce for five years. She is a married mother of two boys. She owns a refrigerator enabling her to sell ice and ice cream. In addition to this, she also sells bedspreads purchased in Mauritania. This explains why she is requesting a loan. She has an order for bedspreads during the current cold weather. 

Awa is mindful of the needs at home, since she helps out with expenses and also takes care of the pocket money for her children, who go to elementary school. She also pays for her housekeeper, who sells cream at an educational institution. 

Awa would one day like to have enough capital, so as not to need loans any longer.

loans.use: to purchase bedspreads to resell

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: Felix  vive en la comunidad  de los cerrones  tiene  38  años, el comenta que desafortunadamente por la misma pobreza no tuvo la posibilidad de ir a la escuela ,  así que  que solo sabe  a leer  y hacer su firma . Ya que desde muy temprana edad le toco trabajar  para ayudar a  su padre en los labores del campo en la siembra de granos básicos. Hoy en día ya tiene su propio hogar  vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos  .Cuando él se casó su padre le regalo unas manzanas de tierra las que ha ido multiplicando  con mucho esfuerzo  en ellas tiene sembrado café el que comercializa  con esto le ha permitido mejorar la vida de su familia ha compuesto poco a poco su vivienda  e incluso compro un sistema solar  hace  como 2 años  lo que beneficio mucho a su familia ya que dejaron de usar candiles. Ahora está solicitando un préstamo para comprar la batería y un inversor  que ya necesita cambiar en su  sistema solar para que este siga funcionado
texts.en:
38-year old Felix lives in the community of Los Cerrones. Because he comes from a poor family he wasn't able to attend school. He only knows how to read and sign his name. At an early age he had to help his father in the fields growing basic grains. Today Felix has his own home where he lives with his wife and four children. When he got married, his father gave him some land and then he worked hard and bought more. He grows coffee, and the income he earns has given him the means to improve the life of his family. He has gradually fixed up his house, and as well bought a solar system two years ago. This has greatly benefitted his family as they were able to stop using oil lamps.

Now Felix is seeking a loan to buy a new battery and inverter for the solar system so that it continues to work.

loans.use: buy a new battery and inverter for the solar panel in his home

loans.name: Gnokolon Group

texts.fr:
GNOKOLON est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de KANGARE. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente  de cosmétiques et d’habillements à l’image de YAH  qui est la deuxième personne débout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la  sous préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
YAH, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 pièces de pagnes wax  et de 5 pièces de bazin.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  KANGARE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
GNOKOLON is a group of the association DANAYA de KANGARE. It comprises four women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. They average 25 years of age. Married with an average of three children, they run different businesses, such as buying and selling cosmetics, rice and clothing, just like YAH, who is the second person standing at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in KANGARE, in the sub-prefecture of SELINGUE, Région de SIKASSO (Republic of Mali). 

They have been in small-scale businesses for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

YAH intends to use her loan to purchase 10 lengths of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and 5 lengths of damask fabrics. She gets her supplies from Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and she sells her products retail in KANGARE to a customer base composed of men and women paying in cash or on credit. 

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
KOTOGNONTALA est un groupe de l’association DANAYA de KANGARE. Il regroupe 5 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de cosmétiques, de riz et d’habits (dont des friperies) à l’image de WASSA  qui est la deuxième personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à KANGARE dans la  sous préfecture de SELINGUE (Région de SIKASSO, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier  prêt solidaire. 
WASSA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à  KANGARE, excelle dans la vente d’habillement. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagne wax  et de 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  KANGARE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
KOTOGNONTALA is a group of the association DANAYA de KANGARE. It comprises five women who know one another through ties of kinship and community. They average 32 years of age. Married with an average of three children, they run different businesses, such as buying and selling cosmetics, rice, and clothing (including secondhand clothing), just like WASSA, who is the second person sitting at the left in the photo. The women live in large traditional families in KANGARE, in the sub-prefecture of SELINGUE, Région de SIKASSO (Republic of Mali). 

They have been in small-scale businesses for several years and are much in demand in their businesses. Concerned about satisfying the growing needs of their customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their first solidarity loan. 

WASSA, who is the group's president and well-known in KANGARE, excels in selling clothing. She intends to use her loan to purchase 20 lengths of Wax 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and a bale of secondhand clothing. She gets her supplies from Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and she sells her products retail in KANGARE to a customer base composed of men and women paying in cash or on credit. 

She is hoping for a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to esell

loans.name: Ena Ruth

texts.es: doña Ena vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, tiene un hijo quien le ayuda en los gastos del hogar, ella posee un negocio de venta de embutidos como: salchichas, mortadelas, jamones, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su casa, es un lugar muy estratégico donde circulan muchas personas, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña ena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas embutidos por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Ena lives in her own home with her life companion. She has a son who helps her with the household expenses. She runs a business selling sausages, blood sausage, ham, etc. It is located in a market close to her house. It is a strategic location with lots of foot-traffic so she has many customers. With what she makes from her work and with what her husband contributes they pay some of the household expenses. Ena is requesting a loan to buy more sausages wholesale to continue with her business and be able to enjoy a better standard of living together with her husband.

loans.use: to buy sausages wholesale.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
ROXANA, tiene 32 años de edad, tiene un hijo de casi doce años. Ella forma parte del grupo "Fortaleza", formado por seis socias, todas ellas mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras.
Roxana, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto ubicado en un mercado de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad la realiza hace aproximadamente 12 años, inició debido a la necesidad de trabajar y generar ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos de su pequeño hijo.
El préstamo recibido lo solicitó para poder aumentar su negocio, lo invertirá en la compra de verduras.
texts.en: ROXANA is 32 years years old. She has a son who is almost 12 years old. She is a member of the "Fortaleza" communal bank made up of six hard-working and enterprising women. Roxana sells vegetables in a market close to her home. She has been doing this for 12 years. She started out of the necessity of having work and to generate some income to cover the expenses of her young son. The loan she is requesting is to invest in expanding her business, buying vegetables.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Nageena

texts.en: Nageena is 47 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nageena’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Nageena has applied for a loan of Rs 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tyres for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Nageena is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tyres for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase onions, tomatoes, vegetables, and potatoes for resale

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 40-years old married woman who lives with her husband and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns rent-a-car business in which he provides motor cars to rent for general purposes and for the wedding ceremonies. He has been doing this work for many years. To carry out his work, he has to stay at shop to deal with the general public. He wants to buy another used car to cope with the demand but due to high cost he is unable to purchase one.

This will be Samina's sixth loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with the cooperation of Kiva her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make her payments on time.

Samina thanks to kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a used car to offer for rent.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian, who lives in the Coastal region of Kenya, is a single lady with no children. She lives in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water.

For the past three years, Lillian has operated a poultry-selling business. Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With this Ksh 20,000 loan, Lillian wants to purchase chicks and chicken feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Michel

texts.es: Michel es una niña con una familia de escasos recursos con ánimo de superarse en la vida para poder ayudar a su familia, actualmente estudia auxiliar en salud oral, pasa a segundo semestre a comenzar las practicas, pero a veces siente que los sueños se ven frustrados por falta de dinero, ella tiene dos hermanos mas que también están estudiando, la hermana mayor también estudia en el mismo instituto, en el segundo semestre, y al ver la situación de los padres con problemas económicos tomo la desision de aportar de aplazar su semestre, para ella fue muy triste tener que dejar los sueños a un lado y por eso busca ayuda en kiva para poder continuar con el estudio, porque las metas son poder terminar elestudio para tener una buena estabilidad laboral y a si ayudar a los padres a mejorar la calidad de vida y demostrarle a los padres que logro los sueños para que se sientan orgullosos, para ella seria satisfactorio saber que con la profesión a demás de brindarle una ayuda a ella misma puede brindarle ayuda a muchas personas que acudan a su servicio, ella agradece que kiva pueda ayudarla brindándole el subsidio para que a si tenga mas posibilidades de pagarse el estudio y cumplir una de las metas.
texts.en: Michel is a girl from a family of scarce resources with a spirit to excel in life to be able to help her family. Today she is studying to be an aid in oral health. It takes a second semester to begin practicing, but sometimes she feels that her dreams are thwarted by lack of money. She also has two brothers that are studying and an older sister that is also studying at the same institute in her second semester. Due to her parents' situation with economic problems, she made the decision to defer a semester. She was very sad to have to put her dreams aside which is why she is seeing support from Kiva to be able to continue with her studies. Her goals are to be able to complete her studies, to have good work stability and therefore help her parents to improve their quality of life and show her parents that she achieved her dreams so that they feel proud. She would be very satisfied to know that with her the profession she will be able to provide help to many people in her care. She is grateful that Kiva is able to help provide the subsidy so that she will have more possibilities of paying for her studies and meeting her goals.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
This is Irma, age 37, from the small town of Kobuleti. Irma is single and lives with her mother.

Irma works as a laboratory assistant for a private company in return for a small monthly wage. In order to generate additional monthly funds, Irma wishes to start clothing trade business. With the received amount she will buy fashionable apparel for children, women, and men in the capital city open market, and sell the items from her store. She’s already hired the commercial space, and needs working capital. After the store is well-stocked, Irma will be able to attract many customers. She will increase the inventory gradually and invest the profit in the same business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a clothing trade business.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia has successfully built her business stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.
