To help her continue to operate her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 50,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and needles to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to deal with personal expenses. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors along with packs of zippers and needles.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for a number of years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a sculptor who makes an income of $8 each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Sokhim is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beams (purlins) and zinc sheeting to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is 50 years old. She is married and resides with seven children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, her husband collects palm juice to sell. He makes an income of $7 per day. Five of her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $20 daily. 

Due to lack of funds, Ny is requesting a loan of $1,200 to pay for her son’s wedding expenses. In the future, she would like to build a fence around her house and help her children earn a higher education.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding expenses

loans.name: María Paula

texts.es: María tiene 62 años de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos quienes a la fecha ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con los gastos del hogar. María y sus hijos habitan en casa muy sencilla y humilde pero propia, la cual con mucho esfuerzo van haciendo las mejoras necesarias. María solicita este Crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una fosa séptica para la cual necesita comprar cemento, ladrillo, arena, hierro y tubos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que es la única forma de poder mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia. Expresa que con lo que percibe de su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras logrará cancelar las cuotas mensuales que el crédito implica.
texts.en: María is 62 years old and a single mother to three children.  Her children are now adults and help with household costs.  María and her children live in a very simple and humble house, but they do own it and, with a lot of effort, they have made the necessary improvements to the house.  María is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in building a septic tank, for which she needs to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron and pipes.  María hopes to be able to count on this loan as it is the only way she can improve her and her family's living conditions. María believes that, with her earnings from her fruit and vegetable business, she will be able to make the monthly repayments for this loan.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, iron and pipes in order to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Monh-Ochir

texts.en:
Monh-Ochir is 36 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger (a traditional nomadic yurt house) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife Tsasanhuu is currently unemployed and stays home taking care of the family. His children are local school students.

Monh-Ochir and his wife have been providing interior construction work for years. He is well known for his qualified work. He and his wife's business is seasonal, thus he herds sheep during winter.

He is now requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase some interior construction tools and other equipment to run their business.

loans.use: to purchase some interior construction tools and other equipment to run their business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, onions, tomatoes, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, onions, tomatoes, maize flour and sugar that will help her to invest back into her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic vegetables and used clothing inventory for his wife's business.

loans.name: Elpidio Jesus

texts.es:
Elpidio vive en la ciudad de aguaytia, trabaja desde hace 2 años en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, con lo cual puede sacar adelante a su familia.

Elpidio está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar más fruta al por mayor y realizar mejoras en el pequeño local en donde atiende, de esta manera podrá brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un local propio y ser un distribuidor de frutas al por mayor”.
texts.en:
Elpidio  lives in the city of Aguaytia. For 2 years he has worked in his small business selling fruit and by doing this is able to bring up his family. 

Elpidio is grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help he will be able to buy more fruit wholesale and carry out some improvements to the small shop where he sells his produce. By doing this he will be able to provide a better service for his customers and keep working towards making his dream come true: to have his own premises and be a wholesale fruit distributor.

loans.use: to buy fruit and set up his shop.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol, así como también a la crianza de ganado, con lo cual obtiene los ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, es un oficio que aprendió desde su juventud.
Invertirá en la compra de medicamentos para el ganado e insumos agrícolas, con lo que protegerá el ganado de posibles enfermedades y dará tratamiento a su cosecha, espera fortalecer su negocio, tener una cosecha libre de plagas, granos de calidad, sus ganancias aumentaran con lo que dará un estilo mejor de vida a su familia.
Sueña con construir su casa de boque, ya que actualmente es de bajareque.
texts.en:
Pedro lives together with his spouse and two children. He cultivates corn and beans for a living. He also raises livestock, with which he obtains income to cover the family expenses. This is a trade he learned in his childhood.
He will invest in the purchase of medicine for the livestock and agricultural inputs, with which he will protect the cattle from possible diseases and give treatment to his harvest. He hopes to strengthen his business, to have a pest free harvest, quality grains, and that his earnings will increase so he can improve the lifestyle of his family.
He dreams of constructing his house of wood, as today it is made of clay.

loans.use: to buy medicine for the livestock and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Wilfrido Roberto

texts.es:
Wilfrido de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a oficios domésticos, tienen 5 hijos, solo dos viven con él;  pero solo una depende de él, ya que está estudiando.

Él es agricultor y tiene unos 12 años de dedicarse a lo mismo, lo aprendió se su padre que se dedicaba a lo mismo y cuando falleció él, fue el encargado de la familia, antes trabajaba aserrando madera. Wilfrido, traslada sus animales por una distancia de 1km y medio lo cual es un tramo de una hora caminando lo hace todo los días,  desde las 6:00 am y los trae a las 3:00 pm.

El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de un par de bueyes para trasladar la cosecha de su cultivo, ya que ese servicio es muy caro y así ahorra en costo y se beneficiara.

Él espera hacerse de un número de animales considerables,  para con esto obtener una ganancia son su venta y así poder darle una educación a los hijos que le han quedado a su mando, y con el préstamo espera lograr ese sueño que tiene.
texts.en:
Wilfrido is 65 years old and studied as far as first grade. He is married and his wife earns a living from domestic work. They have 5 children but only two live with them. He only has one daughter who is dependent on him, as she is still studying.

Wilfrido is a farmer and has been doing this for 12 years. He learnt from his father who was also a farmer and when he died, Wilfrido was left in charge of the family. His previous work was sawing wood. Every day he moves his animals a distance of one and a half kilometres, which means walking for an hour, starting at 6am. He brings them back at 3pm.

Wilfredo will use the loan to buy a pair of oxen for transporting his crop when it is harvested, because this service is very expensive and so he will benefit by making savings on this cost.

He hopes to build up a considerable number of animals so he can make a profit when he sells them and so provide an education for his children who are still under his wing. He hopes the loan will help him to achieve this dream of his.

loans.use: to buy a pair of oxen.

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran, 40 years old, lives in Zestaponi with his father, wife and three children. His father is a truck driver who earns 300 GEL monthly. Amiran's wife works as a nurse at the local village hospital. The borrower himself works as a driver transferring cargo, and earns approximately 200 GEL per month. 

Amiran wants to start a clothing-sales business that will be a source of stable income for the family. A loan of USD 3100 will be a huge support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling them to purchase a stock of clothing and rent a place for trading.  

Amiran has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that enables people to start or re-start businesses.  Thanks to this he hopes to be able to improve his family's quality of life with an increase in household income. Amiran awaits your support.

loans.use: To start a clothing-sales business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 36-year-old married woman who is the mother of three children. She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. For the sake of her children's needs and to meet household expenses, she started doing embroidery at home. The dealer provides her with all the raw materials for knitting embroidery; she completes her tasks along with her daughters over a wooden frame. 

Naseem wants to sells knitted embroidery in her town also so that she can earn more profits for her family. She has become an expert in her art and wants to buy raw materials so she can sell her embroidery in her hometown.

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan to buy raw materials so that she can knit more embroidered dresses to sell and can grow her income. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through a boost in sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenues to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for knitting embroidery dresses.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, age 41, is a married woman and the mother of two children; both are school-going. She deals in selling blankets to the people of her community.   She purchases a variety of blankets from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her community. She always has a great collection to offer to her customers and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Safia is on her fifth loan cycle and applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000. This will help her to purchase a variety of blankets in various colors and designs to grow her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of profits on providing quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase blankets in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia, 52 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has been a vegetable vendor in their village for almost one year. Due to insufficient funds to use in her business, she would like a loan amounting to 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase vegetables such as string beans, eggplants, and root crops to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow so that she can earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as string beans, eggplants, and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Frzana

texts.en:
Frzana is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor for the past four years in a corner of her house. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Due her best efforts at providing services, she has become very famous in her street. She needs to have more customers who come time after time. For this reason, she wants to purchase hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) through Kashf Foundation.  

She is in her fourth loan cycle with good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Yousif

texts.en:
Yousif is 48 years old and has four kids. He lives in Gaza, also referred to as Gaza City, a Palestinian city in the Gaza Strip. It has a population of 515,556, making it the largest city in the Palestinian territories.

Yousif asked Ryada for this loan in order to paint his house and repair the kitchen. This will result in better living conditions, which will help him to take a step forward, because he has a shortage of money. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint his house and repair the kitchen for better living conditions.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 26-year-old married woman. Six years ago, she started a small general store as her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet their household expenses alone. By this time she has retained a good number of customers and earns enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Khalida wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Bory

texts.en:
Bory is 33 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. To make a living, her husband runs a motor taxi. He makes an income of $3 daily. Her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $8 each day to help cover the family’s expenses. 

To improve her family’s finances, Bory is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation. This purchase will help her acquire the ability to run a new business and generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to use for rice cultivation

loans.name: Amigas Unidas De Ventanilla Group

texts.es: Elduapa de 64 años es viuda tiene 02 hijos adultos cada uno con sus familias. Ella pertenece al grupo “AMIGAS UNIDAS DE VENTANILLA ” alcancía recién conformada con 05 socias. Elduapa se dedica al negocio del alquiler de cochera, en su casa ha podido  acondicionar un espacio grande donde diariamente guarda 10 carros de sus clientes, de otro lado también se dedica a la venta de productos naturales como miel de abeja, algarrobina etc. los ingresos que percibe le permiten solventar sus gastos. Elduapa utilizara este préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de productos naturales, esta muy entusiasmada con este negocio y desea seguir creciendo con el, esta agradecida por  recibir este préstamo y a nombre de su grupo quiere agradecer a los inversionistas de KIVA en la foto es la que viste polo color fucsia.
texts.en: Eldupa is 64 years old and has two adult children, each with their own family.  She is a member of the “AMIGAS UNIDAS DE VENTANILLA” communal bank, recently formed with five members.  Elduapa rents out parking spaces at her home.  She has set up a space where she can accommodate 10 cars for her customers.  She also sells natural products such as honey, carob syrup, etc. and uses the income to pay her expenses.  Elduapa will use the money from this loan to continue investing into her business and buy natural products.  She is very excited with this business and wants to grow with it.  She is grateful for getting this loan and with her group is thankful to the Kiva lenders.  She is wearing a fuchsia polo top.

loans.use: to buy natural products

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 35 años de edad se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de frutas y verduras su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado principal que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela pues su producto es fresco y a buen precio con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran salir adelante con los gastos que se les presentan, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su esposo quien trabaja como carpintero, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de fruta y verdura por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y satisfacer a sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ganancias para poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 35 years old and for 20 years has sold fruits and vegetables for a living. Her business is located in the main market that is located near her place of residence. She has many clients as her product is fresh and at a good price with which she obtains her sales. With the help of her husband they move forward in life with the expenses that they face. She lives in her own house with her three children and her husband who works as a carpenter. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase fruit and vegetables wholesale to be able to continue with his business and satisfy her customers and therefore obtain better income to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: El. G.S. Venceremos esta conformado por cuatro integrantes: Jose Gregorio, Ana Francis, Nohemi del Socorro y Silvia Saturnina, todos originario del municipio de chinandega, el cual esta ubicado en el occidente del país y se caracteriza por ser una zona comercial productiva, todos ellos se conocen porque son de la misma zona por lo que optaron por realizar un crédito en grupo solidario, y de esa manera poder ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocios. Jose Gregorio quien es el coordinador del grupo cual el se encarga de las responsabilidad y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma es propietario y administrador de un negocio venta de artesanías como muebles rústicos, adornos, llaveros, cajones, hamacas, alfombras, entre otros, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en uno de los mercados de esta localidad, el cual también ofrece productos de cafetería, almuerzos, desayunos, refrescos y gaseosas, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en sus negocios como: adornos, hamacas, cajones, espejos entre otros y poder suplir con las demandas de sus clientes.-
texts.en: The "Venceremos" communal bank has four members - Jose Gregorio, Ana Francis, Nohemi del Socorro y Silvia Saturnina.  All of them are from the Chinandega municipio, in the west of Nicaragua, an area known for having a strong business sector.  The members of the communal bank known each other as they are from the same area.  They have decided to apply for another group loan in order to be able to support themselves financially and to invest in their respective businesses.  Jose is the group coördinator and is responsible for ensuring that loan repayments are made on time.  He also owns and runs a business selling artisan products, such as rustic furniture, decorations, key fobs, storage boxes, hammocks, rugs, and more.  Jose runs his business out of one of the local markets, where visitors can also buy lunches, breakfasts, drinks, and snacks.  Jose has both regular and one-off customers.  Jose aims to invest this loan in his business by buying decorations, hammocks, storage boxes, mirrors and more.  With this he can fulfil his customers' needs.

loans.use: to buy artisan products, such as decorations, trunks, and more.

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es: Fátima es una mujer muy luchadora, que junto a su compañero de vida y a sus hijos, ha salido adelante en la vida. Ha ido mejorando su calidad de vida poco a poco, y esto lo ha hecho a través de crédito, los que ha ido utilizando para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.  Solicita este nuevo crédito para construir el muro frontal de su vivienda, comprará materiales de construcción  como cemento, arena, piedra cantera y hierro. Trabaja como supervisora en una zona franca. Su compañero de vida trabaja en un taxi, y sus dos pequeños están estudiando.
texts.en: Fátima is a very strong woman, who together with her life companion and their children has moved forward in life. She has been improving her quality of life, little by little, and this was done through credit. She has been utilizing it to improve the infrastructure of her housing. She is requesting a new loan to construct the front wall of her home. She will buy construction materials like cement, sand, stone and iron. She works as a supervisor in the open zone. Her life companion drives a taxi and their two small children are studying.

loans.use: to buy sand, iron and stone to construct the front wall of her home.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a sus 4 hijos y esposa en el Caserío El Muñuño, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de café desde hace trece años, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para darle mantenimiento a su finca y de esta manera mejorar la producción del cultivo de café para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gilberto is 49 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children in the El Muñoño hamlet, a rural part of the Cañaris district, situated in the province of Ferreñafe, which is part of the Lambayeque region on the north Coast of Peru. The locals work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

For the last 3 years Gilberto has earned a living from agriculture, particularly growing coffee. He has asked for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy manure for the upkeep of his farm so he can improve the yield of his coffee crop to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy manure to feed the coffee crop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel appreciates his previous loan, which improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his motorcycle business by purchasing spare parts.

He would like to apply for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to paint his motorbike and purchase a new tire. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to paint his motorbike and purchase a new tire

loans.name: Britaldo

texts.es:
Britaldo tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el Caserío de Alumbral del distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores cuyes, patos, gallinas desde hace tres años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Britaldo is 49 years old and lives with his son in the Alumral settlement of the Oyotun district, a small farming, commercial and livestock community, located two hours from Chiclayo in northern Peru.

He has been raising and selling small animals such as Guinea pigs, ducks, chickens, for the past three years behind his house.  He is asking for a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles to buy balanced feed for his animals so he can generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria’s previous loan helped her purchase more bundles of clothes for her business and thus increase in her monthly income. She managed to open up an Mpesa business (mobile money transfer). Maria is asking for a loan because she believes that through it she will improve her business. 

Maria is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to invest in additional floats (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.

Maria feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits and help her family to cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to invest in additional floats (electronic credits to sell) for her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase rice, beans, ground nuts and maize for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, ground nuts and maize for resale

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who has three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years she has operated a business, selling handbags. She faces a major challenge, namely, seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of women's handbags, in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase more women's handbags for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more handbags for resale

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, solicita más capital debido a que se dispone a incluir como parte de su actividad económica la venta de sorbetes, en esta ocasión comprara sorbete, paletas y concentrado para pollos, esto le ayudara a continuar ampliando la granja e impulsar el nuevo tipo de ingreso.
El crédito anterior le permitió surtir la granja con lo necesario para cumplir con sus pedidos y así  tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jose is asking for more capital for his sorbet business.  He will buy sorbets, popsicles, and chicken feed.  This will help him continue to expand his business and create a new source of income.

He used the previous loan to stock his farm so he could meet his customer demand and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
José, opta por otro crédito para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas y pago del arrendamiento del terreno, con lo que podrá tener una mejor cosecha de maíz.
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar la cosecha de maíz, lo que le facilito aumentar sus ingresos, su economía mejora día con día, su familia se encuentra muy saludable.
texts.en:
José has decided to take out another loan in order to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, insecticides and to pay the rent on his land.  With these items, he will have a better corn harvest.

José's previous loan allowed him to increase corn production, which, in turn, increased his income.  José's financial situation is improving every day and his family is in good health.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, insecticides and to pay the rent on his land.

loans.name: Abdulhafiz

texts.en:
Abdulhafiz is 25 years old, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is the sole provider of the family. He is a soldier, getting a low salary. He said he faces a difficult situation, because his income is not enough to cover his big family's needs. He has a small house and he is well-known in his surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

He intends to renovate his house. He is requesting a loan of YER 300,000 from Al-Amal, with which to buy construction supplies. He will use them for renovating his house. He believes that this loan will positively improve his life. He hopes to be able to provide for his family’s needs and to provide them with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use for renovating his house.

loans.name: Juana Esperanza

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchas ideas, muchos deseos de salir adelante y de prosperar en la vida, con una edad de 33 años de edad en unión libre y madre de 3 hijos quienes están pequeños. Ella viene de una familia muy humilde y trabajadora siendo sus padres agricultores mismos que por la falta de apoyo económico no pudieron apoyar. Fueron ellos quienes le enseñaron a muy temprana edad a trabajar la tierra en la siembra y cultivo de papa, zanahoria y frijol siendo sus clientes los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona en busca del producto que por su buen clima y magnifica tierra se da la producción con facilidad y con mucha higiene. El mayor desafío que a ella se le presenta es el alza de precios en el mercado en los diferentes insumos que ella y su compañero de hogar utiliza para mantener sanos sus cultivos.
Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de insumos que ayudaran a proteger sus cultivos de hortalizas con lo cual pretende obtener excelentes ganancias para cumplir con su compromiso y seguir gozando de esta clase de beneficios y oportunidades que en la vida se le presentan para salir a delante con su negocio y demás.
Sus planes a futuro poder comprar un lote más de tierra para poder construir su propia casa de habitación más cerca del área urbana donde sus hijos puedan tener acceso a la educación y pueda prepararse para convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is a woman with a lot of strength, many ideas, and much desire to get ahead and prosper in life. At 32 years of age and in a common-law relationship she has 3 children who are still young. She comes from a modest and hard-working family who are farmers. They don't have the economic resources to help her.

It was her parents who taught her at a very early age to wok the land in growing potatoes, carrots and beans. Her clients are middlemen who come to the area in search of product because of the good climate and the magnificent land which produces a lot of healthy produce.

Juana's main challenge is the raise in the market prices of the inputs that she and her life companion use to keep their crops healthy. For this reason she has asked COMIXMUL for a loan to buy inputs to help protect her vegetable crops. She hopes to get excellent revenues for meeting her compromises and continue to enjoy the the benefits and opportunities that life presents to continue progressing in her business.

Her future plans are to buy another plot of land to build her own house close to the city where her children can have access to education and prepare themselves to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her vegetable crops.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 44-year-old married man living in the village of Velistsikhe with his wife and two school-age children. Gocha is a builder and works on special projects. Moreover, he runs a family agricultural business and grows grapes in his own vineyard. In fall, he sells his harvest among fruit retailers. 

The existing income is modest and hardly enough to cover high utilities and feeding expenses. Gocha owns a car and plans to use it in a food-distribution business, but he needs money to change his car’s fuel system. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and LLC MFO Credo, permitting the vulnerable poor to start or re-start businesses. 

This loan will help Gocha to pay for changing his car's fuel system from petrol to natural gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. He will also buy stock of frozen food and distribute the products to the local groceries.

The family income will significantly increase, and they will be able to improve their standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to change the fuel system of his car from petrol to natural gas and start frozen food distribution

loans.name: Faton

texts.en:
Faton is in his early 30s and married. His two boy children are young, ages 5 and 7 years old. He is living in an old apartment in the southern part of Kosovo in a small town, under extremely poor and unhealthy conditions. Their windows and doors are very old and need to be replaced, and the toilet is in poor working condition and will need to be replaced as well.

Faton earns a living working as painter, painting homes, businesses and other structures based on client need. His wife is a housewife and stay-at-home mother, caring for their children and home. Although through his work, he tries to generate enough income for his family, it is not enough to pay for renovations in his home. 

Faton is now requesting a loan from KosInvest to renovate the rooms and toilet, and replace the windows and doors. After repairing the house, Faton will be able to create better living conditions for his family, for which he is very thankful. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he appreciate all of the lenders for the help!

loans.use: To renovate the rooms and toilet, and replace the windows and doors in his old apartment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery supplies

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is 41 years old, a married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years with the support of her husband.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan of Rs 50,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.  She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be polite and intelligent. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, bread, milk and other items. He describes his family challenge to be poor supply of water in the area. He will use the KES 27,285 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit his family and enable them store enough water. This is his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is 27 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and one child. He sells cleaning materials and other household items. He has been involved in the retail business for many years. It still needs a lot of improvement, so he is requesting a youth loan of $2300 to purchase more goods and shelves and to repair the store door so he will be able to increase his stock, which will lead to supporting the needs of his family, reinvest in his business, and have good financial conditions.

Khalil is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and shelves and to repair the store door.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is 19 years old.  He is from Gaza. In 2010 he thought of doing something to contribute to the family income, as his parent’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of all the family members.

Since 2010 he has worked in sewing clothes for many shops in his area and distributes it with help from his brothers.  His dream is to make his own brand and sell it in large areas.  

Tamer is asking Ryada for this youth loan to buy another sewing machine and shelves to expand his workshop.  He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine and shelves to expand his workshop

loans.name: Mirida

texts.en:
Mirida is a 43-year-old single, mother of four children who has been in the retail business of selling clothes commonly known as "bitenge" for ten years. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. She carries out farming for additional income. She faces challenges of price fluctuations and seasonal changes yet she hopes to educate her children and buy land for farming. 

Mirida is requesting a loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase leather covers and thread in large quantities to sew women's clothes for the fall season

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 37-year-old married woman, and she has four sons and two daughters.

With this big family, in 2011 she thought to do something to contributing to the family's income as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. So, from 2011 until now, she has been sewing women’s clothes and repairing them like shortening trousers. Her goods are customized according to her clients.

Her dream is to open a business with a large number of employees working in her business to give them the opportunity to work and get income. Muna is asking Ryada for this loan to buy another sewing machine with more options, which will increase the number of clients and improve her financial conditions. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine with more options

loans.name: Cerca Al Cielo Group

texts.es:
JAIME, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltero y forma parte del grupo "Cerca al Cielo", formado por seis socios. Todos ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables y emprendedores.
Desde muy jovencito Jaime empezó a trabajar en el mercado vendiendo un poco de fruta, poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, aún no es lo que el desea pero le gustaría que con el préstamo recibido le ayude a aumentar su mercadería y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas a su clientelas.
texts.en:
Jaime is 19 years old. He is single and is part of the group "Cerca al Cielo" or "Close to Heaven", consisting of 6 members. All are characterized for being hardworking, responsible and entrepreneurial.
Since he was very young, Jamie began to work in the market selling a little fruit. Little by little he has been growing his business, although it's not where he wants it to be. He would like the loan to help him to grow his merchandise to be able to offer a greater variety of fruits to his customers.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of fruit for his business to offer diversity.

loans.name: Mahmayunus

texts.ru: Махмаюнусу 53 года. Он истинный животновод и занимается выращиванием бычков более 20 лет. Махмаюнус в основном откармливает молодых бычков в течение месяца и затем выводит на продажу на местный рынок. Доход с бизнеса является основным источником дохода семьи. Махмаюнус женат, имеет детей и внуков. Он со своей семьей проживает в районе А.Джоми. В данный момент на скотном дворе Махмаюнуса осталось считанное количество скота. Махмаюнус в целях развития бизнеса просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США. На эту сумму он хочет приобрести несколько голов молодых бычков, чтобы увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота. За счет прибыли с деятельности Махмаюнус планирует отремонтировать дом, который очень нуждается в этом.
texts.en: Mahmayunus is 53. He is a true breeder and has been raising steers for more than 20 years. For the most part, he fattens young steers over a month and then sells them at the local market, the revenue from which is the primary source of income for his family. Mahmayunus is married and has children and grandchildren. He and his family live in the A. Jomi region. At the moment, Mahmayunus has very few livestock in his cattle yard. With the goal of developing his business, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD, with which he wants to acquire a few head of young steers in order to increase the number of cattle he can sell. He intends to put any additional profits toward much-needed home renovations.

loans.use: to buy steers to develop his business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and one child. 

Mohammad took a course to be able to repair phones and he worked in many shops to gain some experience. Then, after three years, he decided to open his own workshop.

He needs this youth loan to buy repair equipment to work more efficiently and to buy spare parts for phones, which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.  

Mohammad wants to thank everyone who helps him to achieve success. He believes that this loan will improve his work a lot.

loans.use: to buy repair equipment to work more efficiently and to buy spare parts for phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a esposa en el distrito de Lagunas, una comunidad de un clima fresco, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Con la ayuda de su esposa se dedican a la crianza y venta de animales menores cuyes y conejos, son una familia emprendedora, Luis Alberto ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera tener una mejor producción de los mismos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is 29 years old. He lives together with his wife in the district of Lagunas, a community with a cool climate. It's population is in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It belongs to the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Perú.
With the help of his wife he raises and sells guinea pigs and rabbits for a living. They are an entrepreneurial family. Luis Alberto has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles, or $375, to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals and in this way have a better production to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 28 years old. He lives with his parents in Nablus, a city in the northern West Bank approximately 49 kilometers north of Jerusalem, with a population of 126,132. He works as an employee doing upholstery.

Mohammad is asking Ryada for this loan to paint his house structure, doors and windows. He wants to help his family with this loan to improve the house and make it better, which will allow them to live in it with more psychological comfort. He has a shortage of money to buy the things he needs and achieve for his parents. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to paint the house structure, doors and windows

loans.name: Bharawan

texts.en:
Bharawan is 25 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been involved in tailoring work for 10 years. She stitches clothes for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demand of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors. This will allow her to stitch up more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 38-year-old, married man. He has eight children, and he lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling produce, and he also provides transportation in order to boost his income. He started his business in order to look after his family, especially the children, who need to go to school. He is facing a challenge of having limited capital to increase his stock.

George intends to use the loan to buy a stock of cassava produce to sell. His vision is buying a piece of land for farming, one day.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cassava produce to sell.

loans.name: Chepkorir

texts.en:
Chepkorir is 27 years old, married, and supports a family of four members. Her children are ages six and one year, respectively. She is a charcoal trader and has been in the business for the last three years. Her monthly income is KES 18,000.

Chepkorir is currently servicing her first loan from VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 30,000, that will facilitate her in purchasing more charcoal bags for trade. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into a mobile money transfer business. 

Her dream is to expand her business and, thus, to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 22-year-old married woman doing a business selling milk for many years. She has two calves and one cow in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good education, food and clothing.  

Abida has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  It’s her 3rd year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through Kashf support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Simel

texts.en:
Simel is 30 years old, married to Monicah and supports a family of six. He has been a maize farmer for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of about KES 14,000. He is servicing a second loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya with which he intends to purchase farm supplies. 

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is asking for a loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business. The previous loan enabled her to add more stock in her business; thus, she earned a higher income. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase salt, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale.

She feels that she was able to make a good investment with her previous loan, which to date has allowed her to maintain her level of profits to help her family cover their personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy propane gas, cabbage, dressings, oil, drinks, pork crackling etc.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman, who has four children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Amina operates a food-making business, preparing comestibles like beans and chapati (flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbours.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients, including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income, and establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, including wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Elda Elena

texts.es:
Elda, necesita más capital debido a que la demanda de su negocio ha aumentado, invertirá en la compra de quesillo, chicharrón, aceite, aderezos y bebidas,  lo que le da la oportunidad de contar con negocio más estable.
El  préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar su producción, tiene más clientes, sus ventas mejoraron y las ganancias las utilizo en el pago de las cuotas y en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Elda needs more capital since the demand for her business has increased. She will buy fresh cheese, pork crackling, oil, dressings and drinks, which will give her the opportunity to have a more stable business. 

The previous loan helped her to increase her production and she has more customers. Her sales improved and she used the profits for the family's expenses and to pay off the loan.

loans.use: to buy fresh cheese, pork crackling, oil, dressings and drinks.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino, age 42, is from the village of Khutsubani, west Georgia. She is living with her husband and school-age son. The only one who makes money in the household is Tsitsino’s husband, George, who works as a welder locally and gets a small monthly income.

In order to generate additional income, Tsitsino decided to start up a grocery store near her house and sell various food products. The family needs money to buy stock of merchandise such as cooking oil, pasta, rice, bread, meat products, etc. Tsitsino will work as a salesperson and serve her clients in a friendly way. The family will get more income, and they will be able to cover household expenses as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start up a food market

loans.name: Sophia's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two hardworking women. One of them is Sophia, who is 57 years old and has two children. She has made a living selling vegetables and other foodstuffs from her home for the past 6 years. She has been a client of this MFI (microfinance institution) for the past 4 years. She is requesting this loan in order to buy tomatoes, onions, okra, cabbage, carrots, cucumber and others.

The other member of the group is Mary-Victoria, who is 30 years old and sells wigs. They need GHS 2,600 to maintain their businesses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, okra, cabbage, carrots, cucumber and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar-charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Shubana

texts.en:
Shubana is the age of 38, living with her six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is providing services for polishing newly constructed floors. He polishes the concrete and marble floors. For this purpose, he uses a floor-polishing machine. He has been providing this service for many years. 

A few days ago, her husband's polishing machine has become out of order, due to a fluctuation in electricity. For this is reason, he wants to buy a new machine, but he does not have enough cash in hand.

Therefore, Shubana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy a new polishing machine and continue his services again.

loans.use: to buy a floor-polishing machine for her husband's business.

loans.name: Atanaziraba Women Group

texts.en:
The Atanaziraba Women’s Group is located in the village of Kyango-Kalisizo, Rakai district. The group is dominated by women with just one man as a member. They deal in different business activities like farming, retail, craft and alcohol selling. Some of the members include Mariam, Juliet, Jesca, Molly and Safiina.

Mariam is a divorcee with three biological children, aged 27-22 years, who have all completed school. She lives with two orphans whom she takes total care of by meeting all their basic needs, like tuition, shelter and food, among others. She started farming in 2001, with the main items being bananas and yams. She also raises hybrid goats and two cows. Mariam works five days a week for six hours per day.

She began the business in order to fully support her household. She does outside catering as an additional source of income. Mariam is going to use the loan for paying school tuition for her dependents and also to help with her farming business. Her clients come from around the neighboring towns and the city. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and construct rental rooms. The challenges with her business are limited capital and fluctuations in prices. She is a trustworthy and committed client.

loans.use: To pay tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the windows, doors and roof of his old, damaged house

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 40-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and five children, two sons and three daughters. 

For the past three years, Maha has been working in her store, where she sells cleaning products. It is a good business and she earns a good income, but she would like to improve it. 

Maha took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy more cleaning products for her store to resell. By taking this loan, Maha will be able to improve her business and also her income. Maha appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products for her store to resell.

loans.name: Niezl

texts.en: Niezl is aged 36, married to a farmer, and blessed with three children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 3 1/2 years; in this business she's earning a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her daily profit is usually spent on the school allowances of her three children. Due to lack of capital, she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase beverages, cooking oil, sugar, shampoo, and detergent soaps to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she will be able to improve and expand her store to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, cooking oil, sugar, shampoo, and detergent soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, and dishes (bowls, plates, cups, etc.) for her  business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and a resident of Kabumbi, a suburb of Wakiso. She is a single mother with four children, all of whom attended and completed school.

Irene deals in a business of a retail shop, which is strategically located in the busy trading centre, on a busy street. She started the business twenty years ago with an aim of boosting her daily income. 

She wants a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Uganda shillings) to buy more stock and equipment to serve her clients better.

Irene sells mostly to all kinds of people, especially household consumers who come from different parts of town. She, however, faces challenges of inadequate capital and competition in the market.

Irene is such a determined and committed lady and aims to acquire more money to boost her business, even to set up a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock items to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, age 45, deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals, baby goats, sheep and calves, at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Aisha needs to improve her business to cover her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 60,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kiva and Kashf Foundation. Previously she purchased a buffalo with the help of a Kiva loan. She has been doing this work for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her community. Her husband also assists her in selling milk door-to-door. 

To meet the increasing demand of her customers, she applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way she will be able to grow her sales and profits as well. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 79-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops. She says her family's challenge is water shortage. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a 3000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future she will have more water storage facilities. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 3000 litre water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married woman who has three children, all of whom go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business and improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 35-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw and paying daily use fares because this rickshaw does not belong to him. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children alone. Now his children are growing older and their needs are growing as well. He was worried for many days about how to avoid having to pay daily fares, so he decided to buy his own rickshaw. 

Anwar has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her husband, but at the time of purchasing, the money was not enough. Therefore, she has contacted BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan so her husband can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that now her husband will not have any need to pay daily fares which will help increase his income. 

She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because now he will not have to pay a daily fare to anyone. Anwar is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a single Iraqi youth client, who is 28 years old and lives with his parents. Ali and his father share the family’s monthly expenses together.

Ali owns a shop where he sells kitchenware like plates, cups, pans and teapots. After working with his father for several years, who also has a similar shop, Ali established his own business in 2010 and has gained much experience in this field and an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Ali is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD so he may renovate his shop. Ali is aiming to continue to grow in this field and expand his business in the future so he may provide a better income.

loans.use: to renovate his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is an Iraqi client, who is 32-years-old, married, and has 4 children. Iman works to assist her husband in providing the family income.
Iman works from her own house and specializes in tailoring women's outfits. She has been in this field since her childhood, but chose to take this as her career path in 2012 and opened her own business. She has a lot of experience in this field and has gained an excellent reputation. 

Iman is requesting a sum of $1,500 (USD) as a loan in order to buy two new sewing machines. She aims to expand her business and increase her profits so she will be able to provide herself and her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 30-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good, so she has to think many times before starting any new task. Currently, her husband has started to drive a Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike and sidecar). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which became the cause of high depreciation. Now the rickshaw needs to be replaced because it rattles while driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new Moto Rickshaw.

Rehana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new Moto Rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new Moto Rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 42-year-old married man from Rafah City. He is the father of four sons and three daughters. Mohammad is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad and his wife would like to improve their home and buy all the necessary things.

Mohammad took a $2,000 (USD) loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home. By taking this loan, Mohammad will provide his family with hot water especially in the winter. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water and a tank for the family home

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. Jane describes her family challenge to be poor drainage in the area they live. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank and add stock of cereals. The water tank will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit four family members. Jane hopes that in the future she will do farming. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank and add stock of cereals

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Najah is a 47-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her husband and eight children, six sons and two daughters. 

For the past few years, Najah and her husband have operated a small stall for selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. It is a good business and she earns a good income, but she would like to improve it. 

Najah took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her and her husband to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell in her stall. By taking this loan, Najah will be able to improve her business and also her income.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell in her stall.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 45 years old and married. She has four children, with two dependents attending school. She lives in the town of Dansoman, in the greater-Accra region of Ghana. For the past eight years, Mercy has been working hard to manage her small retail shop, where sells foodstuffs and vegetables.

To help expand her business, Mercy is requesting a loan from ID-Ghana for GHS 2,000. She will use it to buy more vegetables and foodstuffs, to sell to her customers. This loan will help Mercy to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Mercy hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her residential house.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and foodstuffs, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a mother of one child, who goes to school. She lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanajuma has operated a coconut-selling business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase rice, lard, bread, beverages, churros, cheese, butter, sausage, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adilio De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Adilio tiene la edad de 65 años, él vive en la comunidad de los cerrones, y por ser hijo único no pudo estudiar porque le ayudaba a su mama en el trabajo del campo, actualmente  vive con su esposa y sus hijos a quienes les ha enseñado el trabajo en el campo y la siembra del café; en esta comunidad no hay luz eléctrica es por eso que solicita el crédito para la compra del sistema solar y poderle brindar una mejor condición de vida a su familia a la vez  para que en la temporada de cosecha de cafe pueda el iluminarse y asi poder realizar el trabajo de la despulpa del café en  su casa por  la noche y en  la madrugada que sale al trabajo su esposa le pueda alistar la comida .
texts.en: Adilio, 65 years old, lives in the village of Los Cerrones. Being a single child, he was not able to go to school, because he had to help his mother with work on the family farm. He lives with his spouse and their children, whom he taught how to farm and how to grow coffee. In his village, there is no electricity, which is why he asks for a loan in order to buy solar panels. Thus, his family's living conditions will improve, he will be able to shell the coffee beans after sunset in his house, and in the morning his wife will be able to prepare food for him.

loans.use: to buy solar panels for his home.

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a 24-year-old man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He studied only to secondary school and dropped out looking for income sources to help him stay alive. He started his business long ago, selling fruits and vegetables. 

He took a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank in order to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele, which has expanded. This loan will allow him to purchase all types of vegetables and to build a good relationship with his clientele by serving their needs. 

In the future, Hani hopes to expand his business and improve his capital, as this will help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase enough fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of his clientele.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-powered charging set, and a weighing scale

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is 33 years old and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family. She is the mother of five children. To manage her household expenses she operates a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. 

She and her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has a lot of experience. Nargis wants to buy a new Juki machine for her daughter so she can contribute her income from sewing clothes. ("Juki" is a brand name for a line of various sewing machines.)

Therefore, Nargis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new Juki machine for her daughter. She wants to make some savings so that she could arrange the marriage ceremonies of her daughters. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a Juki machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Arber

texts.en: Arber bought a milk cow with the previous loan, and he now wants to buy another one with the current loan he is requesting.

loans.use: To add one more milk cow to the existing one.

loans.name: Drane

texts.en:
This is Drane, a 48-year-old villager from northern Albania and a mother of two children. She has been photographed in the front of the existing stable that she wants to rebuild with this loan. For ten years now, she has been raising livestock as the only source of income. In addition, she has been making and selling embroideries. 

“This is what everyone does here in our region, raises animals and makes dairy products and sells raw milk. Most of us keep cows. It is so much easier with them than goats that run and make it harder for us to run after them. However, villagers who are not far from mountains prefer goats over other animals,” said Drane.

loans.use: to build a stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  more soft drinks, soda drinks and beer for her  business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her  business.

loans.name: Ambarkhon

texts.ru: Амбархон 43-летняя вдова, имеет одну 21-летнюю дочь и внука. Она проживает в городе Исфара. Амбархон имеет 10-летний опыт в торговой сфере. После того как ее муж умер, условия быта семьи ухудшились и Амбрахону пришлось уехать в Россию на заработки. По прошествии нескольких лет Амбархон решила снова начать торговый бизнес в своем родном городе. Она собирается заняться куплей и продажей детской одежды. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом. Амбрахон планирует привозить товар с города Худжанд и продавать в местных деревнях и селах своего города Исфара. Благодаря кредиту она обеспечит себя работой, а семью доходом. Она ждет и верит в поддержку.
texts.en:
Ambarkhon is a 43-year-old widow with one 21-year-old daughter and a grandson. She resides in the town of Isfata. Ambarkhon has ten years of experience in the trading sphere. After her husband passed away, the family's living conditions have worsened and Ambarkhon had to leave for work abroad in Russia. After a few years, Ambarkhon decided to start again a trading business in her home town. She intends to buy and sell children's clothing. For this goal, she applied for a loan.

Ambarkhon plans to bring goods from the city of Khujand and to sell them in the local villages and hamlets of her town, Isfara. Thanks to the loan, she is providing herself with work, and her family with income.

loans.use: to acquire seasonal children's clothing in order to start a trading business

loans.name: Irgash

texts.ru: Иргаш пожилой, но все еще активный житель района Шахритус. Ему 58 лет. Он занимается растениеводством. Ему помогает семья. Иргаш как глава семьи всегда думает о благополучии семьи. Сейчас он намерен параллельно с растениеводством начать прибыльный животноводческий бизнес. Иргаш интересуется куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Для ведения данного бизнеса, у него созданы все условия. К тому же он имеет опыт в выращивании скота, так как держит в своем дворе несколько скотов для хозяйственных нужд семьи. Чтобы начать бизнес Иргаш просит кредит для купли 5 голов крупнорогатого скота. Он каждый месяц будет закупать по 5 голов скота, откармливать их в течение 30-35 дней и затем продавать с наценкой. Он ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Irgash is an elderly but still very active resident of the Shahrituz region. He is 58 years old. He raises crops. He is helped by his family. Irgash as head of the family always thinks about the wellbeing of the family.

Now he intends in parallel with the crops to start a profitable livestock business. Irgash is interested in buying and selling cattle. For conducting this business, he has created all the conditions. In addition, he has experience in raising livestock, since he keeps in his yard a few cattle for the household needs of the family.

In order to start a business, Irgash is requesting a loan to buy five heads of cattle. Every month, he will buy another five heads of cattle, fatten them over the course of 30-35 days and then sell them at a premium. He is awaiting support.

loans.use: to buy five heads of cattle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married lady, 34 years old, and a mother of two children ages 9 and 7. She operates a clothing stall in Narok town and has been running the business for a year, earning a monthly income of KES.18000.

She has borrowed a first loan of KES. 30,000 from Vision Fund Kenya, with which she intends to purchase more clothing for the business, especially for this festive season. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her children.  Her dream is to improve her living standard and own her residential plot someday.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya, age 35, lives in Taiz but had to travel to the Gulf in order to find work. He worked hard there and has managed to save a small amount of money, but his earnings were very low. He came home again in order to be with his family, and he would like to earn his living there by buying a bus and offering transportation services. His savings are insufficient for this purchase, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000,000 YER from AMB.
 
His primary goal is to earn enough money to be able to enroll his two children in a private school, so that they will have a good education and suffer fewer difficulties than their father. Yahya himself was only able to complete primary school because his family could not afford to help him continue his studies.
 
Offering efficient transportation services with his newly purchased vehicle will allow Yahya to generate enough income to better support his family and improve their overall standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a bus so that he can offer efficient local transportation services, allowing him to support his family and improve their standard of living

loans.name: Tilovmurod

texts.ru: Тиловмурод трудолюбивый человек, ему 53 года. Он примерный муж, отец и дедушка. Тиловмурод занимается сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает огородные культуры на протяжении 20 лет. Тиловмурод живет в районе А.Джоми со своей большой семьей, состоящей из жены и шестерых детей. Он сейчас проводит озимый посев и для этого уже распахал землю. Теперь, чтобы посеять семена, он обратился за кредитом. Тиловмурод на сумму кредита хочет приобрести семена лука, моркови, помидора и картофеля, а также топливо. С полученной прибыли он хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. Тиловмурод верит, что в будущем году его дела пойдут к лучшему.
texts.en:
Tilovmurod is a hardworking person. He is 53 years old. He is an exemplary husband, father and grandfather. Tilovmurod is engaged in agriculture. He has been growing garden crops for the last 20 years. Tilovmurod lives in the A.Jomy region with his large family, consisting of his wife and six children. He is now conducting the winter planting and for this has already plowed the land.

Now, to sow seeds, he requested a loan. With the loan amount, Tilovmurod wants to purchase seeds for onions, carrots, tomatoes and potatoes, and also fuel. With the earned income, he wants to increase the livestock count in his livestock yard. Tilovmurod believes that in future years his work will get better.

loans.use: to acquire seeds for onions, carrots, tomatoes and potatoes, and also fuel

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 42-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is running a small gas station successfully, where he sells LPG fuel for rickshaws. In their area a lot of people drive auto rickshaws, and there is a lot of demand for fuel, so he decided to open a gas station so he can earn maximum profits. This strategy became the cause of establishment of the gas station, in no time. He started this business with very low capital, and he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy more LPG cylinders to fulfill the demand.
On account of the rapid increase in the demand for LPG, Kousar's husband wants to buy more gas cylinders, which would enable him to cope easily with the demand. Kousar wants her husband to establish his business in a good manner, so that she could make some savings to ensure the secure future of her children. Kousar is very pleased with this cooperation among herself, Kiva, and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan; she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy LPG cylinders for the gas station her husband runs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar-powered charging set, and a weighing scale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, fish, meat, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 36-year old married woman.  Her husband has been driving Moto Rickshaw for many years. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerks over roads.  Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced with new one because it rattles when driving. 
She requested a loan for her husband, so he can maintain the rickshaw body and can give the rickshaw clients a better riding experience. 
Ruqia thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy new rickshaw body.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, Maggi cubes, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil), charcoal, rice, batteries, biscuits, etc., for her  business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and plantain for her business.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en:
Ezra is a businessman doing tea trade in Butare –Kyamuhunga. He is thirty two years old and is a father of three children aged 6, 4 and 3, and he would like to see all of them through school so that they can compete for jobs on the job market. He also does retail trade in the same area and this boosts his income since it gives him additional income from the shop.
