He started trading in 2011 and continues the business to date with high hopes that it will expand and earn him enough profit. He works four days on the tea business and concentrates on the shop when he is off the tea business, and he says this has rewarded him since he gets more money to cater for his needs. He would like to use the loan money of three million shillings to buy more stock so that he can enjoy economies of scale.

In his tea business he is challenged by the unfavourable weather and untrustworthy farmers, who never supply in the required quantities, making it hard for him to supply the factories with the quantities they would like him to supply in a given period.

Ezra thinks that his honesty has helped him achieve what he has achieved in life to date, and hopes to continue to be the honest man he has always been so that he can achieve his dream in life.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items to sell at a profit

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn, age 43, earns a living by operating a sari-sari (general store) retail business. She offers various everyday goods in her store to members of her community. To earn an additional income, she is engaged in a motorcycle transportation business. Roselyn and her husband have three children and live in Bohol.

Roselyn is requesting a loan in order to buy additional stocks for her store, such as canned goods, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, candies, and snack foods. Through this investment, she will be able to improve the variety of offerings at her store, which will attract more buyers.

Roselyn hopes to make her business a success. Her goal is to save enough money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for her store, such as canned goods, rice, soda, beverages, soap, toiletries, candies, and snack foods

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es una persona honesta y trabajadora vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras, junto con ella viven su esposo y su hija. Su negocio es una  chiclera y venta de frutas desde hace 2 años.
Doña Martha su negocio es muy visitado ya que se encuentra en un punto estratégico y de fácil acceso a su a comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: confites, bombones, paletas, churros, sandias, naranjas, bananos, piñas, papayas, etc.
Doña Martha que necesita el préstamo para surtir más su negocio,  espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios y suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda que estos le hacen a diario.
Doña Martha gracias a esto espera ganar más ingresos que mejoren el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar y así aumentar su negocio y que se convierta en el más grande y conocido de su comunidad y así seguir apoyando a su familia para vivir de una manera mejor que un mejor porvenir. 


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Martha is an honest and hardworking woman who lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and their daughter.  Her business is selling candy and fruit, which she has done for the past two years.  Martha's business is well-visited as it is in a very strategic location that is easily accessible by the community.  

She is in need of this loan to purchase more products like candy, bonbons, lollipops, churros, watermelons, oranges, bananas, pineapples, papayas, etc... Martha needs the loan to stock her business and she hopes that it will help her a lot as she will have the necessary products to satisfy the needs of her customers and meet their daily demands.  

Martha hopes to increaser her earnings to improve her family's living conditions, and expand her business to make it the biggest and most well known in the community so she can continue to support her family, live in a better fashion and have a better future.

Choluteca, Honduras –January 2014

loans.use: purchase candy, bonbons, lollipops, churros, watermelons, oranges, bananas, pineapples, papayas, etc...

loans.name: Agdia Isabel

texts.es: Agdia Isabel 57 años de edad casada con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el oeste del occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser turística, con sus hermosas playas, al igual que la comercialización de mariscos, Agdia es propietaria de un taller de costura en el cual confecciona y elaboran trajes, vestidos de novias, quinceaños, primera comunión, uniformes, togas y servicios de costura en general, negocio el cual lo tiene establecido en su casa de habitación, da poco al credito el cual recupera semanal tiene una clientela establecida las cuales les ofrece variedades estilos de confecciones de ropa, inicia su negocio con fondos propios, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de mejorar su casa de habitacion, el objetivo de este credito es invertir en capital de trabajo como: distintos estilos y colores de telas, hilos, agujas, cintas, encajes, bordados, entre otros, para asi lograr terminar de realizar varios pedidos que ya tiene para este fin de año.-
texts.en:
Agdia Isabel is 57 years old, married and has four grown children.  She is from one of the villages in Chinandega located in the western part of the country, a region which attracts many tourists due to is beautiful beaches.  It is also known for its shellfish industry.

Agdia owns a sewing shop where they design and make suits, dresses for weddings, quinceañeras, and first communions, uniforms, and robes. She also provides tailoring services. Agdia runs her business out of her house and grants only a small amount of credit to her customers which gets paid back each week.  She has regular customers to whom she offers a variety of clothing styles. She started her business with her own money.

One of her dreams is to be able to finish fixing up her house. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital to buy: fabric in different styles and colors, thread, needles, ribbon, lace, trimmings, etc. so that she can finish up various orders that she has for the end of this year.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy fabric, thread, lace, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru: Музафару 58 лет. Он по профессии шофер и зарабатывает  этим на жизнь. Музафар работает в одной фирме водителем. Его водительский стаж составляет 35 лет. Он женат, имеет детей и внуков, и проживает со своей семьей в столице в городе Душанбе. Жена Музафара работает на швейной фабрике портнихой. Невестка домохозяйка, а внуки совсем еще маленькие. Музафар сейчас не может продолжить работу из-за технической неполадки с его машиной. Чтобы вернуться к работе он просит кредит для ремонта машины. Он с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Muzafar is 58 years old. By profession, he is a chauffeur and earns his living in this way. Muzafar works in one company as a driver. His driving experiences amounts to 35 years. He is married, has children and grandchildren, and resides with his family in the capital city Dushanbe. Muzafar's wife works in a sewing factory as a dressmaker. His daughter-in-law is a homemaker, and his grandchildren are still small.

Muzafar now cannot continue work because of technical difficulties with his car. In order to return to work, he is requesting a loan to repair his automobile. He is awaiting support with high hopes.

loans.use: to repair his automobile to continue work

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma  tiene 46 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con su esposo y sus hijos de 4 y 1 año  en el Cantón Urdaneta   Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Vilma se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra  de insumos agrícolas, como abonos, fertilizantes.

Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Ventanas y en Ricaurte. El sueño es tener salud para seguir trabajando y tener una buena producción. Los desafíos que se enfrenta son las plagas y las enfermedades. En sus tiempos libres le gusta cuidar los animales y ver las noticias.
texts.en: Vilma is 46 years old. She is in a civil union and lives with her husband and their children, aged 4 and 1, in the canton of Urdaneta, in the province of Los Ríos. She belongs to the Palmasola communal bank, which is located in the rural area of Palmasola, which belongs to the parish of Ricaurte and the canton of Urdaneta. She is a farmer and grows rice. She asks for a loan in order to buy farming supplies, such as manure and fertiliser, in the town of Ventanas and the parish of Ricaurte. Her dreams are to stay healthy in order to keep working, and to have a good harvest. She faces challenges such as insect plagues and crop diseases. She enjoys caring for animals and watching the news in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Mahmadjobir

texts.ru: Махмадчобир 33-летний фермер, проживающий в районе А.Джоми. У него любящая жена и трое сыновей. Махмадчобир зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь сельским хозяйством. У него нет высшего образования. После окончания школы, он стал зарабатывать. Махмадчобир начал земледельческую деятельность 10 лет назад. Он занимается в основном посевом  овощей. В данный момент он проводит осенний посев. Для этой цели он берет кредит в размере 1500 долларов США, чтобы купить семена лука, моркови, картофеля, а также топливо. За счет прибыли он хочет продолжить постройку своего дома.
texts.en:
Mahmadjobir is a 33-year-old farmer, residing in the A.Jomy region. He has a loving wife and three sons. Mahmadjobir earns a living through agriculture. He does not have a higher education. After graduating from school, he started to earn a living. Mahmadjobir started agricultural activities ten years ago. He mainly grows vegetables.

Currently, he is conducting the autumn planting. For this goal, he is taking a loan of US$1,500 to buy seeds for onions, carrots, and potatoes, and also fuel. With the profits, he wants to continue building his home.

loans.use: to acquire seeds for onions, carrots, potatoes, and also fuel

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en: Jamal, 47 years old, lives in Nablus. He is married and has four sons, three of them attending primary school. Jamal has a shoe shop and has been involved in the retail business for many years. He still needs to make many improvements, so he is requesting a loan from Ryada to purchase more goods and shelves to increase his stock. Jamal is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and shelves to increase his stock.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.es:
Jean Pierre tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí una comunidad que se encuentra ubicado sobre el valle de Zaña, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a una hora con veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, desde hace más de cinco años, trasladando a sus pasajeros a los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y así seguir brindando el servicio de manera segura, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 29 years old, and lives with his wife and child in the district of Cayaltí, a community that is located above the Zaña valley, an hour and twenty minutes north of the city of Chiclayo, on Peru’s northern coast.  The people here work in agriculture, commerce, and raise livestock.

He has been providing transportation to the public with his own motorcycle taxi for more than five years, carrying his passengers to the neighborhoods near his district.  

He has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles for maintenance of his vehicle, in order to continue providing safe service, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase parts for maintenance of his vehicle.

loans.name: Ngutie

texts.en:
Ngutie is a lady, age 43, a wife and mother of seven children between the ages of twenty five and six. She has been trading charcoal to earn a living in the Narok market for the last five years, with a monthly income of KES. 15,000.

She has been advanced her first loan of KES. 20,000, which will be used in the purchase and transportation of more charcoal to the market place to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her farming.

Ngutie is a hardworking lady who is determined to uplift her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a 43-year-old gentleman. He is married and supports a family of three. He has managed a tea plantation in Bomet County, Kenya for the last seven years with a monthly income of about 20,000 KES (Kenyan Shillings). He learnt about VisionFund Kenya from marketing that was carried out in his centre. 

Wilson has been advanced a first loan of 25,000 KES which he will use to purchase to fertilizer for the plantation. He will use the bonus proceeds from the tea sales to buy dairy cows. 

Wison's dream is to educate his children at higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a tea plantation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan of ksh.20,000 to buy sacks of cashew nuts that will help her to invest back into her business. 

She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cashew nuts for her business.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María, a sus 61 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde hace más de 40 años se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección, oficio que aprendió de una hermana. Actualmente trabaja en sociedad con una amiga quien es propietaria de las máquinas de coser, pero María es quien tiene los contactos de los clientes a quienes les prestan el servicio.
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos adicionales, solicita el crédito para comprar una máquina fileteadora con la que podrá comenzar a trabajar desde su casa y podrá ir avanzando para montar su taller independiente, esto le permitirá mejorar los ingresos con los que aporta para el sustento familiar.
María manifiesta que su avanzada edad no le impide seguir luchando para alcanzar sus sueños y por eso seguirá trabajando arduamente hasta lograrlo, pues para ella, montar su propio taller es sinónimo de progreso y mejor calidad de vida para todo su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, married and has two children who she has gotten ahead through much effort and dedication.  For the past 40 years, she has worked in the tailoring industry, a trade that she learned from her sister.  Currently, she works in a partnership with a friend who owns the sewing machines, but María is the one who has the contacts for the customers who use their services.  

With the hope of generating additional income, she is seeking a loan to purchase an overlock sewing machine with which she will be able to work from home and move towards starting her own tailor shop.  This will allow her to increase her earnings which she uses to support the needs of her family.  María states that her age does not prevent her from fighting to reach her dream and because of this, she continues to work hard until she achieves them because for her, having her own shop is synonymous with success and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: purchase an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to offer for sale

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gloria, se decide por otro crédito por los múltiples beneficios que tiene al invertir en su tienda, comprara jabón, detergente, golosinas, bebidas, azúcar, sal, etc., esto le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior mejor el servicio a sus clientes, sus ganancias han mejorado, ha cancelado sus deudas y también compro artículos para el hogar lo que dan a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria has decided to take out another loan to gain the multiple benefits that can result from investing in her store. She will purchase soap, detergent, candy, drinks, sugar, salt, etc. This will help strengthen the business.

With her last loan, Gloria improved service for her customers and her earnings. She paid off her debts and also purchased articles for her home, offering her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, candy, drinks, sugar, salt, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair her husband's car.

loans.name: Al-Waseem Group

texts.en:
Al-Waseem is a group that is composed of four women. They are from Hodeidah, Yemen and work together to help one another. They are hard-working, enterprising women who do not give up easily. Currently they are requesting a loan of 110,000 Yemen Rials (YER) from AMB in order to increase their business levels. 

Elham is the leader of the group. She is 40 years old and a married woman. She has been selling incense and perfume to customers for many years, which has enabled her to develop a significant customer base. Her business has helped her to provide for her family. She is turning to AMB to request a loan of 30,000 YER because she has orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers. She would like to buy incense and perfume which will increase her profit to offer a good quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume to increase her profit

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 24-year-old man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He opened a mobile phone accessories shop two years ago. Abass is a man with very good communication skills, who treats his customers in a very attractive and elegant way. He makes special offers all the time to attract new customers and to keep current customers. 

To keep up-to-date with the new technologies, Abass is requesting a youth loan of YER 380,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise. This new stock is attractive enough to increase his income and to let him dream of a shining future. 

In the future, Abass hopes to expand his business, so that it increases his profit.

loans.use: to add new mobile phones and special accessories to his merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal, rice, and red oil for her business.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a 45-year-old, married woman. She recently started a small general store in her community, to help her bear her household expenditures. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing, and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use it to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages, which will enable her to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil, cassava, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a married woman. Three years ago she initiated a small general store, to help her bear her household expenditures. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices. She has retained many customers, who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of two children; one is school-going. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care.

Naheed wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the loan to buy packs of grain, biscuits and beverages, to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of grain, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Khursheedan

texts.en:
Khursheedan is 48 years old and a married lady. She has been running a small general store in her community, for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices, and she has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Khursheedan makes enough to provide for her family.

To make her store fully-stocked, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use the loan capital to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market, at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar and flour, for her store

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 46-year-old married woman, who has been in the business of selling milk for many years. She has three cows in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her a decent life.

This is her seventh year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with Kashf's support. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000, which she will use to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in the milk-production capacity, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more dairy cow.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida is a 25-year-old married woman who has operated a business selling milk for the past 6 years. She has 4 cows & 4 buffaloes in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to provide her with a decent life. 

This is Abida's 5th year with Kashf Foundation; she happily runs her business with Kashf's support. She has now requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to get an increase in milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Miraj

texts.en:
Miraj, age 51, is the mother of four children. She is expert in stitching bed covers, pillows and curtains and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. She has two years of experience, and has a good client list. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her sixth loan cycle, and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000.  She intends to use this loan to purchase spools of thread, fabric and ribbons, along with packs of needles. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. 

Miraj hopes to grow her business, and dreams of providing a good quality life to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, fabric and ribbons, along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Mearaaj

texts.en:
Mearaaj is a 37-year-old married lady who has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price, and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for Rs 55,000 which she will use to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Naseeran

texts.en:
Naseeran, aged 47, is the mother of five children; she has been doing business stitching pillows and bed sheets for the last 10 years, with the support of her husband.  She prepares sets of pillows and bed sheets and sells them in the market; she also receives orders from the people of her community. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her third loan cycle, and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000. This will help her to purchase spools of thread, fabric, and laces along with  packs of needles.  She would be able to increase her sales, and profits alongside. 

She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase spools of thread, fabric, and laces along with packs of needles.

loans.name: Edilia Marleny

texts.es:
Doña Edilia es una persona luchadora y honesta vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con su esposo y sus hijas. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 6 años.
Doña Edilia vende de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias cercanas a su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: bóxer, camisas, brazier, faldas, blusas, pantalones, calcetines, corpiños, etc. 
Doña Edilia necesita el préstamo para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que contara con las prendas suficientes para cubrir los pedidos y demandas de sus clientes y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento considerable y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. 
Doña Edilia espera que sus negocio siga creciendo y de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos puedan terminara sus estudios y así tener mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Edilia is an honest person, who never gives up. She lives in a village in the southern part of Honduras together with her husband and their daughters. She has been selling used clothing for 6 years. She sells door-to-door in the neighbourhoods and villages near her own. She needs the loan to buy more clothes to sell, such as boxers, shirts, brassieres, skirts, blouses, trousers, socks, ladies' underwear, etc. Edilia needs the loan in order to meet customer demand, and hopes that it will help her as much as she needs. Her goal is to buy enough clothes to fulfill her customers' orders and drastically increase her sales. With this extra income, she hopes to improve her family's quality of life. Edilia wishes her business would keep growing so that she can support her family and help her daughters complete their studies, so that they are given better chances for the future.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, 39, a resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a security guard, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilou operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

She is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marilou hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
This is Edwin, 51, resident of Payatas, Philippines. He is married to Jessica, a housewife, and they have children. He, together with his wife, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Edwin operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. His products are pork, beef meat, and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Edwin's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, Edwin is requesting a PHP 11,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork and chicken needed in his business. 

Edwin dreams that his business will continue to grow and have more sources of income. He hopes to give his children a good life and education. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for pork and chicken needed in his business.

loans.name: Janeth Geoconda

texts.es:
Geoconda tiene 33 años de edad estado civil unión libre vive con el esposo y sus hijo de 15 y 3 años  en el Cantón Urdaneta Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Palmasola que se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Palmasola, pertenece a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta se dedica  a  labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Geoconda se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para el arriendo de terreno y para la compra de insumos para la siembra.  Las compras realiza en el Cantón Ventanas en el Comercial García.

Su sueño es comprar un terreno para el cultivo para no arrendar. El desafío que enfrenta es  el trabajo contra la maleza. En sus tiempos libres le gusta pasar en casa y ver televisión.
texts.en: Geoconda, 33, lives with her common-law husband and two children (aged 15 and 3) in the canton of Urdanetas, in the province of Los Ríos. She belongs to communal bank Palmasola, located in the residential area of Palmasola, which belongs to the parish of Ricaurte, in the canton of Urdaneta. Agriculture and livestock farming are the main activities here. Geoconda is a farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to pay for rent on the land and to buy the farming supplies she needs. She makes her purchases at a store called García in the canton of Ventanas. Her goal is to buy land so as not to pay rent anymore. The challenge she faces is weeding. In her free time she enjoys staying at home and watching television.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser to grow sweetcorn and rice.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is a 57-year-old woman from the town of Panglao, Bohol.  She is married with three grown children.  She raises and sells hogs to earn a living.  Her hog raising business started quite some years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional pigs, piglets and hog feed. This will help Vicenta sell more pigs during a given period of time.  The income goes to food for the family and reimbursement back into the same business.

 In the future, Vicenta hopes to expand her business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy  additional pigs, piglets and hog feed

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro tiene  33 años   habita en la  comunidad de los cerrones, el no pudo terminar sus estudios porque tuvo que ayudarle a sus padres en la labor en el campo; en la actualidad él vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, dedicándose al cultivo del café y guineo, también la esposa le apoya con venta de ropa en las comunidades cercana viendo que en la comunidad no hay luz eléctrica haciéndole falta para que los hijos hagan las tareas por la noche y para que la esposa cuando se levanta en la madrugada , es por la cual es que está solicitando el crédito para la compra de un panel solar para su casa y así mejorar la situación de vida a su familia
texts.en:
Pedro is 33 years old and lives in the Cerrones community.  He was not able to complete his education because he had to help his family with working in the fields.  Currently, he lives with her wife and their three children.  He works growing coffee and bananas.  His wife also helps by selling clothing in the neighboring communities.  

The community that they live in does not have electricity, which prevents his children from doing their homework at night, and makes it difficult for his wife to get ready when she gets up early in the morning.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan to purchase a solar panel for his house so that he can improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: purchase a solar system for his home.

loans.name: Ever Antonio

texts.es:
Ever es un campesino de 42 años de edad, 15 de ellos dedicados a trabajar como mayordomo en diferentes fincas cafeteras de la región, con los ahorros que pudo recolectar durante tantos años de arduo trabajo pudo adquirir un lote de tierra con casa, en la que comenzó a cultivar café, plátano y banano, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo; un tiempo después, con el apoyo de un crédito en una entidad financiera, pudo adquirir otra finca pequeña junto a su vivienda y en el momento se encuentra en proceso de sembrar para aumentar su producción.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas y pagará la mano de obra, esto le ayudará a mejorar sus cultivos y tendrá una cosecha más productiva, generando así mayor nivel de ingresos.
Poco a poco Ever va construyendo su futuro con el apoyo de su esposa, y cada vez avanza un paso más para poder terminar de cancelar la deuda de la finca que adquirió y mejorarla, aumentando sus cultivos y organizando la estructura de la casa, pues se encuentra en mal estado; todo esto dará como resultado la generación de progreso y mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar para su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Ever is a 42 year old farmer.  He has worked as the foreman on different coffee farms in the region.  With the savings that he was able to gather during so many years of arduous work, he was able to get a plot of land with a house.  On that land he started to grow coffee and bananas.  His harvests are gathered and sold at the town market.  Some time ago, with the help of a loan from a financial entity, he was able to get another small farm alongside of his house.  He is now in the process of planting in order to increase his production.

He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay for labor.  This will help him to improve his crops.  He will have a more productive harvest.  This way he will generate a greater level of income.

Little by little, Ever is building his future with his wife’s help.  Time and again he advances one more step in order to be able to finish paying the debt for the farm that he got.  He is improving it and increasing his crops.  He is working on the structure of the house because it is in bad condition.  All of this will result in the generation of progress, better living conditions, and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Lediz Yanira

texts.es:
La señora Lediz es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con ella viven su esposo y sus hijos. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas desde hace 5 años.
Doña Lediz vende de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias cercanas a su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más materia prima como ser: atado de dulce, harina papel empaque, leña aceite, etc. que necesita para elaborar su producto.
Doña Lediz espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los insumos suficientes  para  seguir elaborando sus producto de forma continua y as satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda que estos le hacen a diario y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que mejoren el estilo de vida de la familia. 
Doña Lediz espera aumentar su negocio y que esta se convierta en el más grande y conocido de su comunidad y así  seguir apoyando a su familia para vivir de una manera mejor que un mejor porvenir. 


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Lediz is a very hard-working and honest person. She lives in a village in the southern part of Honduras, together with her husband and their children. She has been selling sweets for 5 years, as a street-vendor, in the neighbourhoods and villages near her own. She needs the loan to buy more ingredients and supplies, namely unrefined whole cane sugar, flour, oil, wrapping paper, and firewood. Lediz hopes this loan will be a great help in purchasing enough ingredients and supplies to keep making her product and meeting customer demand every day. She wants her sales to increase in order to earn more money and improve her family's life. Lediz hopes that her business will keep growing and one day become the best-known one in her village. This would help her achieve her ultimate goal of supporting her family and giving it a better future.


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014

loans.use: to buy the ingredients and supplies she needs for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 26 años de edad, vive con esposo, sus tres hijos y su suegra en casa propia, ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y muy emprendedora, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  venta de ganado y también a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos,  ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende también su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado, y  asi poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en: She is 26 years old, lives with her husband, three children, and mother in law in their own home.  She is a hardworking, responsible, and enterprising woman and has been selling livestock for several years.  She also raises corn and beans.  She has good customers and has managed to win her customers’ trust.  She offers quality prices on her products and has decided to invest into the care of her livestock, since this is her business.  She is asking for this loan so she can buy vitamins for her livestock so she can continue providing her family with a better quality of life without limits.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and feed.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her grocery store which she has been running for five years now. Her loan helped not just her business, but also the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their family.

She would like to apply for another 34,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
La socia Estherlin, la socia continua con el negocio de venta de comida y tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende sus productos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a sus negocios los cuales le traen satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona alegre, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para su tienda como azúcar y leche.
La socia se siente agradecida con los inversionistas de Kiva y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de celulares, venta de ropa, tienda de abarrotes, venta de papa, venta de comida, preparación de bebidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Los socios que aparecen a la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo
texts.en:
Member Estherlin is still in business selling food at her grocery store. She sells her products to the customers that come in. She has been doing this for quite some time now, and her business rewards her both financially and personally. She is a joyful person and she wants to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for her store, such as milk and sugar. She is grateful to Kiva lenders and promises to comply with her payment terms. 

The other members work selling cell phones, selling clothing, grocery store, selling potatoes, selling food, preparing drinks. The person whose face is covered does not belong to the communal bank. The members in the attached photos had persmission to arrive late to the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store, such as milk and sugar.

loans.name: Ma. Niña Suzeth

texts.en:
Margaret Niña Suseth, age 24, operates a variety store to earn an income. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. She also sells charcoal for additional income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

Margaret Niña lives in Tanza, Cavite, with her partner Jonathan and their children. Jonathan also runs a small business. She and Jonathan manage their household while operating their respective businesses, and they work hard to continually provide income for their family's everyday expenses.

Margaret Niña is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 8,000 in order to help her continue in the operation of her store. She will use the loan funds to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Her goals are to expand her business and to ensure that her family is always in good health. 

Margaret Niña meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her store inventory

loans.name: Mesaidi

texts.en:
Mesaidi is a married mother of two children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mesaidi has operated a business selling cashew nuts at the market for the past eight years. Her main customers are passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to purchase soft drinks, bread, wheat and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, bread, wheat and sugar for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is asking for a loan because she believes that through it, she will improve her business. 
The previous loan enabled her to expand her retail shop and earn more money. Due to her hard work and profits she gained from her retail shop, she managed to open another business, selling women wrap clothes (Lessos).

She is requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to purchase pieces of lessos for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of lessos (women wrap clothes) for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive con su hija de 10 años, para apoyar en los gastos de su casa tiene una tienda y se dedica a la crianza de ganado, sus labores las distribuye en el transcurso del día, sus labores inician a las 6:00 a.m. y finalizan a las 6:00 p.m., es un oficio que aprendió por cuenta propia.
Invertirá en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, golosinas y concentrado para ganado, fortalecerá su negocio y atraerá a más clientes con lo que percibirá mejores ganancias y podrá cancelar las cuotas de su crédito, así como también cubrir los gastos familiares.
Anhela darle la oportunidad de estudiar a su hija y hacerle mejoras a su tienda.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has a 10 year old daughter.  She has a store and raises livestock in order to support the household.  She works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm and she learned this on her own.

She will buy rice, beans, cooking oil, snacks and concentrated livestock feed.  She will strengthen her business and attract more customers so she will increase her income and pay off her debt.  She will also be able to cover her family expenses.

She wants to provide her daughter with the opportunity to attend school and also make improvements to her land.

loans.use: to stock her store and buy feed.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, solicita capital para comprar cuatro tareas de caña de azúcar, las cuales molera para hacer dulce de atado, que luego venderá, el resto lo utilizara para pagar mano de obra que le ayude a recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo tener los insumos agrícolas necesarios para tener una cosecha abundante con lo que sus ingresos son mejores y mejoro el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Luis is requesting a loan to buy four cords of sugar cane to grind for making "dulce de atado" [log-shaped candy] to sell.  He'll use the rest of the money to pay laborers to help him harvest basic grains.

With the previous loan Luis bought the agricultural inputs he needed to have an abundant harvest.  His income is better and he improved his family's lifestyle with the loan.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane

loans.name: Hameedan

texts.en:
Hameedan is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of five children. The income earned by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing this work for many years and has become famous for providing good-quality milk in her locality. At present, she has one cow and two buffaloes.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 50,000. She will use it to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, onion, Vita, rice, etc to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar, candy, etc, for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar, candy, chewing gum, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a fridge for her restaurant business

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: Kausar is a 33-year-old married woman. She appears in the photo with her husband, a driver by profession, who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but the rickshaw now requires proper maintenance to keep it in functional. Kausar has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better service to his passengers. Kausar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Abdulhakim

texts.en: Abdulhakim is a 22-year-old who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a soldier who earns daily income. He works hard to offer a good life for his family. Most of the money he makes is spent on raising his family. His house is very old and needs a quick renovation. The house is vulnerable to collapse at any time. He knows that such a thing needs a lot of money. He has started renovating his house, but is now short of money. He needs to complete the renovation task, so he asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to buy construction supplies. He hopes that after the completion of his house renovation, he will feel safe in his house with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete the renovation task of his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory (palm oil, rice, charcoal, beans, okra, peppers, etc.) before the rainy season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, aspirin, ibuprofen, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 46-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has seven buffaloes and sells their milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Shahnaz has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one more buffalo. Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo

loans.name: Vivan

texts.en:
This is Vivian, 44, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Leodigario, an employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Vivian operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Vivian earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Vivian hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana de 38 años de edad, estudio educación media, es madre soltera de dos hijos estudian 4º  y 7º grado,  por lo que solo vive con sus dos hijos. Los cuales de penden de ella y ella es la que sostiene el hogar.

Ana se dedica a la elaboración de piñatas desde hace 3 años, aprendió en unos talleres comunales  impartidos por visión mundial . Ademas, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados  de maíz y sus hijos le ayudan con una pequeña crianza de pilapias, esas son las actividades que ella realiza para sacar adelante a sus hijos ,  Ana viaja en un autobús de lunes a sábado hasta donde tiene el taller de elaboración de piñatas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar  materia prima para el taller de las piñatas(alambre,papel y pegamento),  fertilizantes para sus cultivos( semilla, abono y pesticidas) y comida para los peses .Elle dice que el préstamo le sera de mucho beneficio dado que podrá hacer mas piñatas y surtir mas su tienda  y tener mejores cultivos.


 Los suenos de Ana son , preparar académicamente a sus hijos y hacer crecer la piñateria y que Dios le de salud para seguir trabajando para que esto se le haga realidad y gracias a los créditos espera lograrlos.
texts.en: Ana, 38, is a single mother of two. One is in fourth grade and the other one in seventh grade. Only her two children live with her, and they are dependent on her, which means she is the sole breadwinner in her household. Her main job for the last three years has been manufacturing piñatas. She learned how in a government-sponsored course given by the city. She also grows 7,000 square meters of sweetcorn, and her children help her by taking care of a small tilapia farm. Thus, she manages to support her children. Ana travels by bus from Monday to Saturday to her workshop. The loan will be used to buy supplies like paper, flour for the paste and wire for the piñata framework to make piñatas. Another part of it will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide, as well as feed for the fish farm. Ana says the loan will be very useful, because she will be able to make more piñatas, sell more of them, and also have a better harvest. Her dreams are to see her children complete their studies, to make her workshop grow, and to stay healthy in order to make her dreams, with the help of loans, become reality.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her workshop, fertiliser for her crops, and feed for her fish farm.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 40-year-old, married woman. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of kinds of cloth from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Kousar requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different lengths of cloth for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different sorts of cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna owns and operates a mini grocery store within her locality. She is 51 years old and has four children.Two of her children currently attend school. Myrna and her husband work together to give their children a better education. She’s keeping up her mini grocery store and wants it to do well so that she can generate sufficient income.

Myrna would like to take out a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soap, biscuits, sugar and seasonings to sell. She believes that this loan will enable her to have continued growth of her business. She is hoping that lenders will grant her requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beverages, noodles, canned goods, soap, biscuits, sugar and seasonings to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, rice, pepper, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es: Morena de 42 años de edad es divorciada y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad y su pequeño nieto de 4 años de edad. Morena trabaja como empleada doméstica por lo que recibe un salario mensual que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener la economía de su familia. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de la vivienda ya que por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, polines y madera.
texts.en: Morena, who is 42 years old, is divorced and lives in her own home with her two children, who are ages eighteen and twenty, and her little four-year-old grandson. Morena works as a domestic and earns a monthly salary that allows her to support her family and maintain her household economy. In order to improve her living conditions, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in building her home's corridor, which she has been unable to finish due to lacking financial resources. She will use the requested amount to buy sheet metal, beams, and wood.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, beams, and wood to finish building a corridor in her home.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan José tiene 38 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus bailes tradicionales del Tonderos, elaboración de dulces típicos de la zona y el trabajo artesano de joyas de plata, su población también se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la elaboración de pan y dulces, esta actividad lo realiza de manera diaria, es un emprendedor que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de insumos, sacos de harina, azúcar, levadura entre otros para la preparación de sus productos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan José is 38 years old. He lives in the district of Morropon, a community known for its tonderos (traditional dances), its traditional home-made local sweets, and its craftmanship in silver jewelry. Residents also work as farmers, merchants, and raising livestock. It is located two hours from the city of Piura, on Peru's northern coast.

He works making bread and pastries. He does this every day. As an entrepreneur, he is requesting a 1,000 nuevos soles loan from Edpyme Alternativa in order to buy ingredients: sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, and other items to prepare his products and offer them to his customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is 29 years old and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a hard-working and very honorable man; always committed to getting ahead.

All his life, he has been working hard and earning money to assist his family. He is a kind man who works as a soldier in the public sector, making a low salary. He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but the amount he has is not enough to buy what he needs.

So, he is requesting a loan from AMB to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house. He dreams to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy home appliances and furniture to use in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more charcoal to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to resell

loans.name: Martino

texts.en:
Martino is a 37-year-old man from the town of Panglao, Bohol. He is married and has a 6-year-old child. He operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services. He transports customers from one place to another. In addition to his motorcycle transportation business, he also operates a hollow block business. He makes and sells hollow blocks as an additional source of income. He is asking for a loan to buy supplies like sand, gravel and cement, to produce more hollow blocks to meet the family's daily needs.

In the future, Martino hopes to expand his business and increase business profitability for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy supplies like sand, gravel, and cement to make hollow blocks

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. Her husband works as a carpenter to support their family. She  engages in raising and selling hogs. Her business started quite a few years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy  additional piglets and feed.This is essential in her hog raising activity.


In the future, Daria hopes to expand her business for sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Salustia

texts.en:
Salustia is a driven farmer who works a day job and raises her kids, in addition to taking care of her sheep. She is also a strong leader and female role model within her community; she has vision and the power to convince others. She is investing in a 10-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because part of that vision includes reducing her farm's environmental impact while concurrently reducing operating costs. 

Salustia's biodigester will convert the abundant sheep waste produced on-site into renewable biogas and potent, natural biofertilizer, allowing her family to decrease their reliance on expensive, non-renewable propane to cook and heat bathwater in addition to improving their soils without petroleum-based agrochemical fertilizer usage. This loan represents 47% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.use: to purchase a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove

loans.name: Mayra Jeakelinne

texts.es:
La señora Mayra es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto con ella viven su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es una  pulpería desde hace 5 años.
Doña Mayra su negocio es muy visitado y conocida por los vecinos de su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: arroz, manteca, pan, refrescos, churros, queso, mantequilla, embutidos, huevos, café, frijoles, azúcar, etc.
Doña Mayra espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios y suficientes para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y cubrir la demanda que estos le hacen a diario y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento y gracias a esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia.
Doña Mayra espera aumentar su negocio y que esta se convierta en el más grande y conocido de su comunidad y así  poder apoyar a sus en sus estudios para que tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra is a responsible and hardworking person who lives in a community in southern Honduras. Her husband and two children live with her. Mayra's business is a grocery store that she has managed for five years.

Her business is well-known and frequented by the neighbors in her community. She needs this loan in order to buy more products such as rice, lard, bread, soft drinks, snack foods, cheese, butter, cured meats, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, and other items.

Doña Mayra expects this loan to be of great help since she will have a sufficient supply of needed products to satisfy the needs of her customers and meet the daily demand. In addition, her sales will increase. The extra income will be a benefit to her family's lifestyle.

Doña Mayra hopes to increase her business and convert it into a larger establishment that is recognized in her community. She also wants to support her children in their studies so that they will have greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, lard, bread, soft drinks, snack foods, cheese, butter, cured meats, eggs, coffee, beans, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Unidas Para Alcanzar El Exito Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “UNIDAS PARA ALCANZAR EL EXITO” está integrada por 08 socias trabajadoras. Una de sus integrantes es Carmela de 41 años, ella es madre de 4 hijos, en la alcancía tiene el cargo de tesorera el que desempeña con mucha responsabilidad. Carmela se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza empezó este negocio hace 4 meses animada por una amiga, los productos que más vende son cremas, perfumes y shampoo, ella esta agradecida porque gracias a su trabajo solventa los estudios de sus hijos. El préstamo solicitado  lo utilizara para la compra de productos de belleza de esa manera cumplirá con los pedidos de sus clientas y podrá comprar para tener en stock. Carmela esta agradecida a los inversionistas de KIVA por este préstamo que es de mucha ayuda para ella y su grupo comunal. En la foto es la que viste polo color turqueza sin mangas, el Sr. Maximo no se encuentra en la foto pidio permiso por motivos personales, la Sra que viste polo azulino es una clienta pasiva del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Unidas Para Alacanzar El Exito" (United for Reaching Success) consists of eight hardworking members. One of the members is Carmela. She is a 41-year-old mother of four children and serves as the group treasurer with great responsibility. Carmela started selling beauty products four months ago with one of her friends. The products she sells the most are crèmes, perfumes, and shampoo. She is grateful for her work because it has allowed her to provide for her children's education.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy beauty products. This will enable her to have stock so that she can fulfill the orders from her customers. Carmela is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan since it will be a great help to her and her Communal Bank. In the photo, Carmela is wearing turquoise sleeveless shirt.

Sr. Maximo does not appear in the photo because he requested permission for personal reasons. The woman wearing a blue shirt is an inactive member of the group.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

loans.name: Ana Gladis

texts.es: Ana de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella posee un pequeño negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación donde vende golosinas y refrescos, desde hace un año, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios, con la que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir algunos gastos que se les presentan en el hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas mercadería como: gaseosa, jugos, agua , galletas, churros, dulces, etc. y continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y asi podrá seguirle dando a su familia junto con su esposo lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. She has a small business located in her home where she sells snack foods and soft drinks. Her business has been in operation for a year. Ana has many customers because she offers good prices. This enables her to make sales so that she can help her husband with some of the household expenses.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sodas, juices, water, cookies, snacks, and sweets so that she can continue her work. This is her only source of income and she would like to continue helping her husband provide what their family needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, water, cookies, snacks, and sweets.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 30 years old, married, and has three children. She is engaged in a business selling fish. According to her, she is able to earn 400 PHP a day. Analyn wants to earn more income in order to give her family a good life. To make her dreams possible, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase different kinds of fish. She hopes through this investment she can provide better living conditions to her family and operate her business profitably.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fish to sell

loans.name: Felly

texts.en:
Felly is 44 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pag. City. She is married with five children.                       

Felly has a shop that sells dressed chicken. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to pay for dressed chicken to stock and sell.                                                                            

Felly has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Felly hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for  dressed chicken to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 39 years old and has a specialty business selling her own homemade fish paste in the village. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been managing her business for over ten years. She is thankful because she is able to cover her family's needs.

Thelma is patient and industrious in making fish paste for sale. Now, Thelma wants to increase her income through adding additional fish to use in making“bagoong” (fish sauce) but she suffers from shortage of capital. So, she decided to request a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy a greater volume of fish. Hopefully, her loan request will be approved.

loans.use: to buy more fish to process and sell as fish sauce

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: María de 61 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo quien es jornalero y sus tres hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan. El negocio lo tiene adecuado en su hogar de habitación desde hace 25 años. Este negocio es muy importante ya que con lo que gana su esposo no logran cubrir los gastos del hogar. Solicita este crédito FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios (harina, sal, levadura, etc.) Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así invertir en su negocio con el fin de mejorar sus ventas e ingresos y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, who is a laborer, and their three children. She works as a baker, making bread. Her business has been set up in her home for 25 years. Her business is very important to them because what her husband earns is not enough to cover their household expenses. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing the ingredients she needs (flour, salt, yeast, etc.) This financing will allow her to invest in her business in order to improve her sales and income, which in turn will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, salt, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and seven children; five of them attend public primary school in Jenin. Jenin is a Palestinian city in the northern West Bank. It serves as the administrative center of the Jenin government, and is a major agricultural center for the surrounding towns. In 2007, the city had a population of 39,004.

Latifa is asking Ryada for this loan to paint her house and build doors and windows, which will help warm her house, especially now in the winter. Latifa is very grateful to everyone who helps her. 

The one who appears on the photo is her husband, Loa’ay. For cultural reasons, she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to paint her house and build doors and windows, which will help keep her house warm, especially now in the winter.

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa’ is 28 years old. He lives in Nablus with his wife and two children. He works as an employee at a constriction field.
Alaa’ is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to repair the ceiling to prevent the flowing of rain water and to paint the walls. That will give warmth for his family at home and reflect a better life conditions. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair the ceiling to prevent the flowing of rain water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and expand the coffee business.

loans.name: Jardines De La Luz Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JARDINES DE LA LUZ”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Erlinda ella es viuda y tiene 52 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de productos de belleza, la socia vende lápiz labiales, cremas y perfumes, la socia lo vende por catálogos ofreciendo a diferentes personas o amigos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar labiz labiales, cremas y perfumes.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de imprenta, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de cosméticos.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank Jardines de la Luz. This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to Cusco province, in the department of Cusco.

Erlinda is one of its members. She is a widow and is 52 years old. She has three children. Her business is selling beauty products. She works selling lipsticks, creams, and perfumes by catalog. She offers her products to different people and friends, and works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for five years now and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to open a shop where she could sell her beauty products. She is requesting this loan to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

The other members do business selling cakes, printing services, selling groceries, and selling cosmetics.

Member Erlinda wants to thank everyone who is a part of this dream by making these resources available and promises to comply with her payment terms.

loans.use: to buy lipsticks, creams, and perfumes.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés, es un padre que se dedica a trabajar muy duro para darles  a sus dos hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad lo mejor, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos (maíz, frijol y maicillo) y también realiza trabajos de albañilería, son oficios que aprendió por su propia cuenta y ya tiene 15 años de realizarlos.
En esta ocasión utilizara el capital para pagar la recolección de la cosecha de la temporada, lo que le facilitara tener sus granos básicos a la venta en un menor tiempo y asimismo tener sus ganancias a tiempo para cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
Sueña con dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse académicamente y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Andrés, is a father who is dedicated to working hard in order to give his two children, ages 10 and 13, the best in life. He grows basic grains (corn, beans and sorghum) and also does masonry work. He is self-taught in these trades and has been doing them for 15 years.

He will use the loan to pay for the seasonal harvest, which will make it take less time to get his grains on sale, and therefore he can make his profits in time to pay his debts.

He dreams of giving his children the chance to succeed academically and improve his home.

loans.use: to pay for the seasonal harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil and peppers for her business

loans.name: Sandra Fabiola

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 23 años de edad estado civil casada vive con el esposo  y con sus hijos de 2 y 3 años, Vive en el  Cantón Pueblo viejo provincia de los Ríos.
La ventanilla se llama LA PAULINA se encuentra ubicada en el parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto La Paulina, pertenece al cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Sandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace tres años y a la cría de animales. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar.
El crédito solicito para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para la siembra de maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener un sembrío de cacao.
Le gusta jugar con sus hijos en sus tiempos libres.
texts.en:
Sandra is 23 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and their two children, who are ages two and three. She lives in the canton of Pueblo Viejo, in Los Ríos province.

Her solidarity group is La Paulina, located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in La Paulina, which belongs to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. The members of this solidarity group work farming and raising livestock.

Sandra is a farmer growing corn and rice and raising animals. She has been doing this for three years. She buys her products in Ventanas and sells them in the market of that town.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies and fertilizer for growing corn and rice. The loan has helped her increase the income available to her family and to invest. Her dream is to have a cacao plantation. In her spare time, she enjoys playing with her children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
Abdullah is a 26-year-old who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Approximately one year ago, Abdullah started his business; a grocery store selling staples. He did this in order to generate enough income to support his household, where he lives with his family. This business is Abdullah’s source of income, so that he is able to give his family a better quality of life.
