loans.name: Sophanna

texts.en:
Sophanna (pictured here) is 31 years old and lives in a village approximately 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 2005, and has one daughter who attends school. Her husband is a construction worker. 

Sophanna is a garment worker. She wants to build a fence around her house so that she can protect her elements and her land property.
 
Hence she decided to apply for a loan!

loans.use: To build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Abdel Kareem

texts.en:
Abdel Kareem is a 20-year-old single young man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His mother works as an employee in a local firm. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Abdel is a student in the university where he studies business administration. He would like to finish his studies, earn a BA degree, and find a job. 

Abdel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. 

By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to do his homework and read articles. Abdel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Sadafgul

texts.ru: Садафгул жительница района Хуросон. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на территории Российской Федерации. Он уехал, чтобы прокормить свою семью. На данный момент он все еще работает и живет там. Садафгул в основном воспитывала детей одна. У нее два сына и дочь. Садафгул около 8 лет занимается куплей и продажей скотов. Она закупает бычков и после длительного откорма продает на том же рынке. Этой деятельностью она покрывает свои семейные расходы. Сейчас Садафгул планирует купить по больше бычков, чтобы увеличить количество скота и тем самым и свою доходность от данного бизнеса. Но она самостоятельно не может сделать покупку, поэтому она просит Вас помочь ей.
texts.en: Sadafgul lives in the Khuroson  region. She is 46 years old and married. Her husband is currently in the Russian Federation. He  went there in order to be able to support his family. At present he still lives and works in Russia. Sadafgul mostly had to raise her children  on her own. She has two sons and a daughter. For about eight years, she has been buying and reselling cattle. She buys calves and after fattening them for a long time, resells them at the same market. Thanks to this business she covers her household expenses. Now Sadafgul plans to buy additional calves in order to increase her livestock and therefore her business income. However, she is unable to pay for this purchase on her own, which is why she asking for your help.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat was born in 1962. He is married, and has six children, three sons and three daughters. Shavkat lives with his family in a rural area. 

Shavkat has his own business more than 10 years; he grows potatoes and wheat. Shavkat knows his work very well, and he has great experience and works his land with pleasure. 

He is asking for a loan of 2,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He does not have money, and that’s why he is asking a loan. 

This loan will help him plant his crops and get a good harvest.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Yanet Azucena

texts.es:
Yanet es una mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de un hijo al cual quiere mucho y por ello con mucha dedicación trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, ya que este le permite poder tener ingresos para poder salir adelante.

Yanet esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá insumos e implementos para su negocio como verduras y abarrotes al por mayor, asimismo cubiertos, platos, vasos, entre otros con lo cual podrá atender mejor a sus clientes y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un gran restaurante”.
texts.en:
Yanet is a very hard-working woman.  This is primarily because she has a child, whom she loves very much.  That is why she works with great dedication in her small business of selling food.  This allows her to be able to have income in order to be able to get ahead.

Janet is grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to their help, she will be able to buy supplies and implements for her business.  She will buy things like vegetables and wholesale groceries.  She will also buy cutlery, plates, and glasses, among other items.  With this she will be able to better tend to her customers.  She will continue struggling in order to make her big dream a reality.  Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, groceries, utensils, and implements for her business.

loans.name: Yaquelin

texts.es:
Ella es yaquelin esta estudiando auxiliar de enfermería, en este momento esta en el 3 semestre y en practicas, el motivo por el cual necesita de la colaboración de kiva es porque anteriormente ella pagaba con un auxilio educativo, esto se lo dieron porque ella no trabaja y la mama trabaja en obras de construcción por días, le esta pagando esta carrera ya que a ella le gusta la enfermería porque para ella es una alegría salvar vidas y colaborar a las personas, auxiliar a las personas mas enfermas.
Ella tiene un niño de 10 años y en este momento esta en estado de gestación, vive con sus suegros, pero quien le esta ayudando es la mama, ella es la que el da una mano y en verdad la señora yaquelin se esmera tanto que en este momento esta en practicas, ella estudia tanto para ayudar a darles un auxilio a la gente y para sacar adelante a sus hijos, esperar terminar sus estudios para poder graduarse con alegría.
Señores de kiva por favor espero que le puedan colaborar a yaquelin ya que ella necesita de ustedes.
Si no se puede obtener la ayuda la mama con mucho dolor y pena le dijo que no le podía colaborar en caso que le subieran a la cuota, en el futuro espera ser una excelente enfermera con esmero y esfuerzo.

Gracias
texts.en:
This is Yaquelin, who is studying to become a nursing assistant. At the moment, she is in her third semester of practicums. The reason she needs assistance from Kiva is because she previously paid with financial aid that was given to her because she did not work and her mother was working at construction sites during the day. Yaquelin would like to pay for her degree because she enjoys nursing and getting satisfaction from saving lives, working with other people, and helping those in need of the most care.

Yaquelin has a 10-year-old son and is pregnant at the moment. She lives with her in-laws, but the person who is helping her is her mother who is always willing to give a hand. It is true that Sra. Yaquelin is striving to do her best at the moment while she is in her practicum. She studies because she wants to help people and move forward along with her children. Yaquelin expects to finish her studies so that she can graduate with joy.

Yaquelin asks for the assistance of the Kiva lenders since she is need of their help. Her mother said that she is not able to assist Yaquelin, which gives her great pain and anguish that she cannot help her daughter with her expenses. In the future, Yaquelin hopes to be a successful nurse who works with great care and effort. Thank you.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition and enrollment fees.

loans.name: Rosa Estela

texts.es:
Rosa de  19 años de edad,  es soltera vive con su mamá y hermanos. Es cosmetóloga tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta labor,  anteriormente trabajo para una sala de belleza en la capital; fue ahí mismo donde aprendió a realizar este trabajo cuando vivió 6 meses con una tía. Desde que regreso donde su mamá aperturo su negocio en la comunidad prestando sus servicios de maquillado, corte de cabello etc. A domicilio para promocionar su negocio actualmente lo tiene ubicado en casa de su mamá. Su negocia lo abre desde las 8:00 de la mañana en adelante.


El dinero lo utilizara, para comprar una plancha eléctrica, secadora de cabello, una silla cómoda para sus clientes, así como otros utensilios necesarios para su negocio esto le permitirá darse a conocer más y atender cómodamente a los clientes.

Su sueño a corto plazo, es aumentar sus clientes y progresivamente ir creciendo en su negocio, la cual le permitiría obtener sus propios ingresos y lograr una estabilidad laboral y económica que están difícil en estos momentos poder alcansar.
texts.en:
Rosa, 19 years old, is single. She lives with her mother and siblings. She is a cosmetologist and has been doing this work for 2 years. Previously she worked for a beauty salon in the capital; it was there where she learned to do this work when she lived with an aunt for 6 months. Since she returned to her mother she has opened her business in the community, providing in-home services in makeup, hair cutting, etc. in order to promote her business. Currently she has her business in her mother's house. Her business is open from 8:00 a.m. onward.

She will use the money to buy an electric iron, a hair dryer, and a comfortable chair for her customers, as well as other utensils necessary for her business. This will allow her to get to know her customers better and attend to them more comfortably.

Her short-term dream is to increase her customers and progressively grow her business, which would let her earn her own income and achieve work and economic stability, which are difficult to be able to reach these days.

loans.use: to buy an electric iron, a hair dryer, and a comfortable chair for her customers, as well as other necessary utensils for her business. This will allow her to get to know her customers better and attend to them comfortably.

loans.name: Husen

texts.en: Husen lives with his family in a rural area. He is married and has four children. Husen works hard to earn a living and has been busy growing potatoes and wheat for more than 20 years. His wife helps him grow potatoes and wheat. Husen lives poorly, because his income is not enough to buy a car or build a new house. Husen always wanted to offer for his family better living conditions. He is going to sow wheat and potatoes, but does not have the money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Madelina

texts.en:
Madelina is 42 years of age, married, and has four children. She is in the business of selling dried fish. She loves her work so much, because it is of great help in improving their poor living.  In three years of operation, she has kept her business going to better their living. 

For her to earn a higher income, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more fish to sell. 

Hopefully, she will receive an appropriate and good profit as she uses her loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 24 years old and married, with one child. She works hard to provide a better way of life for her family. Jenelyn manages a piggery business. With her determination to get ahead in life, she requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Jenelyn hopes to sell them at a high price, in order to save for emergency needs and education for her only child.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins to use for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Shorahim

texts.en: Shorahim lives in a small village of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Shorahim is a very loving father. He grows potatoes and sells his harvest in a local market. Shorahim’s wife helps him manage the  business, which is his only source of income. He has been working hard in his field for more than 15 years and has great experience. Shorahim is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing potatoes. He hopes that he will get a good harvest. Shorahim awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for sowing potatoes.

loans.name: Safae

texts.en:
Safae is a married youth client from Iraq who is 29 years old and a father of a child. He is the only provider of the family. 

Safae owns a blacksmith shop. He specializes in making doors and windows. He has been in this field since his youth. He established his own career in 2009 and now he has hired an employee. He has built up a good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. 

Safae is requesting a sum of USD 3,000 as a youth loan to buy two specialized pieces of equipment for his work. This loan will aid Safae in growing his business and increasing his profits, so that he will be able to provide his children with a good education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy two specialized pieces of equipment for his work.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es: Rosalva de 36 años de edad reside en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 17 años y 14 años de edad. Su esposo falleció hace algunos años por lo que Rosalva es la que lleva la economía del hogar y se esfuerza por dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de joyería de plata, acero inoxidable y enchape. Dicho negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 años y la venta la realiza de forma ambulante. Desea invertir en su negocio por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería como: anillos, cadenas, pulseras y aretes.
texts.en:
Rosalva, age 36, lives in her own house with her two children, ages 17 and 14.  Her husband passed away some years ago.  That is why Rosalva is the one who manages the finances for the household.  She puts forth great effort to give her family better living conditions.

She buys and sells silver, stainless steel, and silver plated jewelry.  She has had this business for eight years, and she sells in an itinerant manner.

She wishes to invest in her business.  That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI.  She will buy a greater quantity of merchandise like rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains, bracelets, and earrings.

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Crecer”  está constituida por 07  socios que han demostrado ser personas responsables.  Clelia es viuda y tiene 03 hijos independiente. A sus 61 años Clelia ha logrado dar educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con una librería ubicada en su vivienda.  En esta oportunidad solicitó el crédito para la compra de útiles escolares como lapiceros, cuadernos, fólderes, borradores, entre otros. El deseo de Clelia es de seguir implementando su negocio, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. El grupo “Crecer” agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Clelia se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color lila.
texts.en:
The group "Crecer" is composed of 7 partners who have proved to be responsible people. Clelia, who is pictured sitting first on the right and wearing a pink polo shirt, is a widow with three independent children. At 61 years old Clelia has managed to provide her children with an education and to improve her income. 
She currently has a bookstore located in her home. Clelia requested a loan to purchase school supplies such as pens, notebooks, folders, erasers, etc. Her wish is to continue running her business, thereby ensuring that she will have greater earnings. 
The group "Crecer" is grateful for the support they have received and is committed to continue working well.

loans.use: to purchase pens, notebooks, folders and erasers.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 30 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Jonalyn earns a living by selling processed foods, particularly longganisa and dried fish. Jonalyn earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase 120 packs of "longganisa" (homemade meat product) and 50 kilos of dried fish for retail. 

Jonalyn has been a member of PMPC for one year and one month. In the future, Jonalyn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase 120 packs of "longganisa" (homemade meat product) and 50 kilos of dried fish.

loans.name: Esperanza Y Progreso Group

texts.es: Martha de 58 años es casada y tiene 05 hijos independientes, actualmente pertenece al grupo “Esperanza y Progreso” conformada por 07 socias trabajadoras que han demostrado ser personas responsables. Martha se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo sigue apoyando a su familia. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos, pantalones, camisas, blusas y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Terminar de construir su vivienda es su mayor deseo. El grupo “Esperanza y Progreso” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Martha se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo color rojo.
texts.en: Martha is 58 years old, married, and has five adult children.  Currently, she belongs to the “Esperanza y Progreso” [Hope and Progress] group, which is comprised of seven hard-working members who have proved to be responsible.   Martha sells clothing and continues supporting her family with the fruit of her labors.  She is requesting the loan to purchase T-shirts, pants, shirts, blouses and thus, be able to offer them to her customers.  Her greatest wish is to finish building her home.  The “Esperanza y Progreso” group is grateful to the people that made this loan possible.  Martha is sitting, the first from the left, dressed in a red shirt.

loans.use: to purchase T-shirts, pants, shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Omaira

texts.es:
Ella es omaira, esta en el área de auxiliar administrativo en salud, a ella esta profesión le sirve para salir adelante en la vida por su hija, ya que es un medio que le sirve para trabajar, igualmente le parece muy interesante estar informada sobre el área de salud y todas sus actualidades y beneficios. Ella vive actualmente con el padre de su hija en el sector de bosa, pagan un arriendo, el es el único que trabaja en la familia, mientras que omaira estudia los sábados y entre semana se la pasa en la casa cuidando a su hija de 2 meses de nacida.
Ella quiere salir adelante con esta carrera, por eso ella quiere que kiva la beneficie ya que ella no tiene el suficiente dinero para poder pagar la cuota que algunos alumnos están pagando por semestre.
Omaira quiere darse un mejor futuro en su vida, y no solo a ella si no también a su hija, brindar un mejor servicio a la gente dándole una buena información y brindándoles un mejor servicio.
texts.en: This is Omaira.  She is in the health care assistant program.  This profession will help her to get ahead in life for her daughter's sake, as it is a means for her to work.  She also finds it very interesting to be informed about healthcare and all its updates and benefits.  She currently lives with her daughter's father in Bosa locality.  They pay rent, and he is the only one working in the family, while Omaira goes to school on Saturdays and stays home taking care of her 2-month-old daughter during the week.  Omaira wants to get ahead via this career path.  She wants Kiva to help her since she doesn't have enough money to pay the tuition some students pay per semester.  Omaira wants to give herself a better future, not just for herself but also for her daughter, and provide a good service to people, giving them good information and providing them with good service.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester

loans.name: Fiorella Esther

texts.es:
Fiorella tiene 20 años y trabaja como ayudante en un pequeño salón de belleza de su ciudad, gracias a este humilde empleo puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante, es por ello que le trabaja con mucho empeño y entusiasmo.

Fiorella esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá solventar los gastos para poder estudiar un curso sobre coloración de cabello, lo que le permitirá mejorar su trabajo y poder tener un mejor ingreso, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Estudiar una carrera universitaria y poder tener su propio salón de belleza”.
texts.en: Fiorella is 20 and works as an assistant at a small beauty salon in her city. Thanks to this humble job, she can earn an income to get on in life. This is why she works with a great deal of determination and enthusiasm. Fiorella is grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to them, she will be able to pay for the cost of doing a hair-colouring course, which will allow her to improve her work and earn more money. In this way she can continue to fight to turn her great dream into a reality: to do a university degree and to be able to have her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to be able to pay for a course on hair-colouring.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Since she was young, Mariana loved sewing and clothing. After she immigrated to the US from her native Portugal in 2000, she went into business with her very own tailoring business. Eventually she expanded this business into dry cleaning. For over ten years, she has enjoyed success and has become well known in her South River, New Jersey community.

However, this success stands in stark contrast to the disaster Mariana faced in October 2012 when Hurricane Sandy struck. With the borough of South River being so close to the Raritan River, the storm hit Mariana’s business and community harder than most. Many of the businesses located on her street are still shut down, without any plans of returning. Although Sandy forced Mariana to close for three months, she has worked hard to make 2013 a bounce-back year. Her revenue is now caught up to where it was before the storm, and she has replaced much of the supplies that she lost.

However, she still has more work to be done, and is still catching up with the damage from flooding and three months of closed business. Mariana will use this loan to pay for coat hangers, plastic covers and zippers she needs to run her tailoring and dry cleaning business.

loans.use: to pay for coat hangers, plastic covers and zippers.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is an 18-year-old lady who lives with her four siblings and her parents in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Madaba. She is studying for a Bachelor's degree, majoring in International Relationships and Strategic Studies. Now in the first year of her education journey, Sofia is planning to work in her study field after graduating to start helping her family financially.

Because her family is currently facing a financial crisis and unable to pay her upcoming semester fees, Sofia has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem is an Iraqi client. He is 42 years old, married and the father of four children. He is the sole provider for the family. 

Basem owns a small shop where he sells and changes engine oil and filters. He has been in this field since 2003 and has gained much experience. Basem's business has been growing fast in his neighborhood, and he has been gaining an excellent reputation. 

Basem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to install a rolling shutter for his shop and to build a ceiling. 

Basem is aiming to improve his business and increase his profits so he can educate his children and take care of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter for his shop and to build a ceiling.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 58 years old and widowed. She is currently residing in a rural community with her only child. Aside from farming, she also runs a small variety store to earn additional income. 

She aims for further improvement of her business, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of assorted candies, snack foods, shampoos, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. 

She hopes that her loan request will be granted, so she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of assorted candies, snack foods, shampoos, laundry soaps, canned goods, beverages, seasonings and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Ilce Yessenia

texts.es: Ilce de 22 años de edad es soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus abuelos y su madre. Ilce se dedica a la crianza de pollos desde hace tres años. También trabaja como tutora de niños en su localidad. Con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos desea invertir en su negocio de pollos comprando mayor cantidad, alimento y vitamina para los animales. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para proceder a hacer la compra y así poder contar con una mayor capacidad de oferta.
texts.en: Ilce, 22, is single and lives with her grandparents and her mother in their own house.  Ilce has been raising chickens for three years.  She also works as a tutor for children in her community.  In order to increase her income she wants to invest in her chicken business by buying a greater quantity of animals and food and vitamins for them.  For this reason she requests this loan from FUSAI so she can make the purchase and be able to have a greater supply capacity.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and food and vitamins for them

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela de 57 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo Y sus dos hijos. Adela se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma junto a su esposo llevan la economía del hogar. Desea mejorar su negocio de pollos por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos, alimento y vitaminas para los mismos. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que de esta forma espera lograr aumentar las ventas como sus ganancias.
texts.en: Adela, 57, owns her home where she lives with her husband and their two kids.  Adela has been raising and selling chickens for a long time, and this is how she and her husband make their living.  She wants to improve her chicken business, so she requests this loan from FUSAI to buy a larger number of chickens, and food and vitamins for them.  She hopes to receive this funding because with it she hopes to be able to increase her sales and her profits.

loans.use: to buy chickens, and food and vitamins for them

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a married client from Iraq who is 40 years old and has four children. She assists her husband to provide the family income. Nidal is a tailor and works from home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child, but in 2010 took tailoring to a new level and started sewing clothes for a living. She has strong experience in this field. Nidal is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. She will use this loan to buy two new sewing machines. Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. By doing so, she will be able to educate her children and assist her husband in providing their family with a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Adrian Rosendo

texts.es: Adrian Rosendo mayor de edad casado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por la producción del ron, la caña y la azúcar, es propietario de un taller de ebanistería/carpintería el cual elabora todo tipo de muebles como: roperos, camas, chineros, cómodas, juegos de sillas, comedores, mesitas de noche entre otros, cuenta con clientes fijos y eventuales, en otros municipios como león y chinandega, Adrian poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio y les ha brindado a su familia una mejor estabilidad económicas, uno de sus sueños es poder terminar de construir su casa de habitación e tener su negocio en otro lugar donde pueda comercializar mas su muebles, el financiamiento de este crédito es para invertir en capital propio en la compra de madera, pega, tornillos entre otros ya que tiene varios pedidos y la madera con la que cuenta no le cubre sus ventas las realiza al contado al igual que sus compras cuenta con cinco trabajadores ademas de el y su esposa. Adrian agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Adrian is married and has two children.  He is originally from a municipality in Chinandega, in the west of Nicaragua.  This is an area known for producing rum and sugar.  Adrian owns a furniture and carpentry workshop where he makes all sorts of furniture, such as wardrobes, beds, china cupboards, commodes, sets of chairs, bedside tables and more.  Adrian has both regular and one-off customers from other towns such as León and Chinandega.  Little by little Adrian has managed to progress with his business and it has given his family more financial stability.  Adrian dreams of being able to finish building his house and to have premises just for his business, so that he can sell more of his furniture.  This loan will be used to invest in working capital by buying wood, glue, screws, and more.  Adrian has various orders to fulfil and he does not have enough wood for these items.  Customers pay Adrian in cash.  Aside from Adrian and his wife, the business has five employees.  Adrian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders who are supporting poor people.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, glue, screws and other items.

loans.name: Jyan Carlos

texts.es:
Jyan vive en la ciudad de Camaná y trabaja como chófer de moto taxi desde hace varios meses, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día, ya que de este trabajo depende que pueda tener ingresos para salir adelante, es por ello que es responsable y educado con sus clientes.

Jyan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento a su vehículo y de esta manera conducirá un vehículo en mejor estado, así podrá seguir trabajando duro para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Jyan lives in the city of Camaná and has been working as a mototaxi driver for several months. He works around 10 hours a day, as he depends on this work to have the income to get ahead in life. This is why he is responsible and polite with his customers.

Jyan is grateful to the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help they have offered him, he will be able to undertake maintenance on his vehicle and in this way drive a vehicle in better condition. This will enable him to continue working hard so that he can make his greatest dream a reality: "To have my own home."

loans.use: To maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es: El señor Juan es una persona soltera y no tiene esposa ni hijos dependientes, vive en una casa en alquiler. Su única herramienta de trabajo es un vehículo el cual lo trabaja como trufi y hace una ruta interprovincial en la zona este, pero el mismo se le arruino por fallas mecánicas y es por eso que solicita un crédito para refaccionar su vehículo, ya que tiene gastos pendientes y no puede ahorrar su dinero para poder reparar su herramienta de trabajo, de esta forma podrá seguir trabajando y lograra cubrir todos sus gastos.
texts.en: Juan is single, and has no wife nor dependent children. He lives in a rented house. His only work tool is a vehicle which he operates as a fixed-route taxi, and does an interprovincial route in the eastern area.  But his vehicle has broken down due to mechanical problems, and that is why he is requesting a loan to repair it. He has outstanding expenses and cannot save his money to be able to repair his work tool. In this way he will be able to continue working and will manage to  cover all his expenses.

loans.use: to make repairs to his taxi, his sole source of income

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
Jose tiene 23 años y trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, el labora alrededor de 10 horas al día ya que esta es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante y sobre todo poder solventar los gastos de sus estudios, ya que se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de prótesis dental; es por ello que se esfuerza mucho y atiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad.

Jose está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le ha n brindado el podrá comprar una mesa de comedor para su hogar, ya que actualmente no tiene y de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y sobre todo poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su propio consultorio dental”.
texts.en: Jose is 23 and works as a moto-taxi driver. He works about 10 hours a day as this is his only way of making money in order to make progress and, above all, to be able to cover the costs of his studies. He is currently studying a technical course on dental prosthesis. This is why he makes a lot of effort and looks after his customers in a very friendly way. Jose is grateful to Kiva lenders since, thanks to their help, he can buy a dining-room table for his home, because at the moment he hasn't got one. In this way he can improve the quality of life for his family and, most of all, he can continue to fight to make his dream a reality: to have his own dental consultancy.

loans.use: to buy a dining-room table.

loans.name: Jeimy Jimena

texts.es:
Ella es jeimy estudia en la sede campo alto, vive con la mama y las dos hermanas, en este momento se encuentra estudiando administración hotelera, no tiene los recursos necesarios para costear su carrera completa ya que vive con los hermanos y a la mama le toca muy dificl con todo. Este convenio es de mucha ayuda para ella, para que pueda cumplir sus metas y tenga un trabajo estable y a si pueda tener la facilidad de ayudarle a su mama con todos sus pagos y para entrar a la universidad y hacer la profesional.
Aunque en este momento no tiene la posibilidad de ayudarle a la mama con la mensualidad piensa hacer todo lo que este al alcance de ella para colaborar en lo que pueda. 

Gracias
texts.en:
This is Jeimy and she is studying in Campo Alto, in Bogotá.  Jeimy lives with her mother and two sisters and she is currently studying hotel management.  Jeimy does not have the finances to pay for all of her studies as she lives with her siblings and it is very difficult for her mother.  This loan would be of great help for Jeimy to achieve her goals and to have a stable job.  She will then be able to help her mother with household costs and can go on to study at university and have a profession.

Although Jeimy is currently unable to help her mother with a salary, she plans to do everything she can in order to help her.

Thank you.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for one semester.

loans.name: Aghavni

texts.en:
Aghavni lives in Nor Armavir village of the Armavir region. She is a nurse who works in the local clinic. 

Aghavni lives together with her husband and two children. Her husband is retired with pension, her daughter is a student, and her son has been involved in agriculture. Aghavni, in addition to her work as a nurse, runs a farm. With the help of her son and husband, Aghavni keeps two pigs and cultivates land (watermelon, grass, apricot trees).

Since she realizes that agriculture is very important for sustaining her family's living conditions, Aghavni would like to expand her business. She asks for this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to cultivate the land and to increase her livestock by 3 pigs. This will allow her to earn more agricultural income and run her farm in a more sustainable way. Aghavni has already taken out a loan from a local financial institution, but, unfortunately, wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to her recent hard work, Aghavni is able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a poor credit history and do not have access to credit.

The loan is very important for this hard working woman to be able to increase her income and ensure a better life for her family.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer to cultivate the land and to increase her livestock by 3 pigs.

loans.name: Fredy Antonio

texts.es: Fredy tiene 25 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo de engorde desde hace mucho tiempo. Su deseo es convertirse en líder de su localidad en cuanto a la venta de pollos se trata. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de pollos de engorde y así incrementar su oferta y mejorar sus ventas y ganancias. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y proceder a hacer la compra lo antes posible.
texts.en: Fredy is 25 years old, and for a long time has been raising and selling chickens for fattening. His wish is to become a local leader when it comes to selling chickens. As indicated above, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that he can invest in the purchase of a greater quantity of chickens for fattening. This will enable him to increase his supply and improve his sales and earnings. He hopes to be able to access the loan and proceed with his purchase as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of chickens for fattening.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El señor Roberto es un joven trabajador, no pudo concluir el bachillerato ya que por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, y se vio en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; es soltero y vive con sus padres, tiene gran experiencia en el rubro de la construcción civil ya que lleva más de 2 años en esta actividad; cuenta con un vehículo que es su único patrimonio. Actualmente solicita un crédito para reparar el motor de su vehículo con el cual trabaja para el traslado de sus herramientas, de esta forma podrá seguir en su actividad, y además podrá seguir colaborando a su familia con el fin de tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young worker. He was not able to finish high school, as for financial reasons he did pursue higher education. He found it necessary to look for work and therefore to set aside his studies. 

He is single and lives with his parents. He has considerable experience in the construction area, as he has been in this occupation for more than two years. He has a vehicle, which is his only asset. Now he is requesting a loan to repair the engine of his vehicle, which he uses for transporting his tools. This way he will be able to continue his livelihood, and continue contributing to his family, so that they can have better living conditions.

loans.use: To repair the engine of his vehicle.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie, age 33, is single. She owns and operates a retail store for almost a year; in this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her profits are usually spent on her retail store and food allowances on her parents.
Due to financial constraints, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase beverages, coffee, biscuits, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell. 

She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted by some generous lenders so that she can improve her business to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, coffee, biscuits, canned goods, and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mayram

texts.en: Mayram was born in 1969. She is married and has four children. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 20 years. Mayram sells milk, kefir, sour cream, cheese and other dairy products from her cows in a local market. She has her regular customers, because her milk products are high quality and very tasty. Mayram’s husband grows agricultural products. Mayram and her husband work hard, but earn little income. Mayram lives with her family in a house that is in poor condition. Mayram wants to repair her house, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and paint to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement, wood, and paint to repair her house.

loans.name: Tuqa

texts.en:
Tuqa is a 19-year-old lady who lives in a sector in Jordan called Salt with her two siblings and her parents. Her father works at a water company. She is seeking a diploma in business. She is in her first year, which is the beginning of her study journey. 

Tuqa is planning to work in her field of study after she graduates to start helping her family financially. Her family is currently facing a financial crisis, which is the reason they are not able to pay her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac lives in Maphombe, a small town in Kwale County. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers  in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives, and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Isaac is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 23 years and they are currently growing oranges on their farm. Isaac is excited about beekeeping because it will provide him with honey.

This is Isaac’s first loan with Honey Care. He intends to use the proceeds from his beehives to build a house for his family. Isaac’s hope for the future is to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Residing in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, Khursheed is a 45-year-old mother of five children, three of whom go to school. Her husband has been successfully running a motorbike spare parts shop for many years to support his entire family.    

In order to meet increasing demand and boost his income, he wants to offer more parts to his valued customers. Khursheed is therefore requesting a loan so he can buy additional spare parts such as tyres, clutches, gear levers, brake shoes and other essential tools. She is hopeful this loan will help to  generate more profit, 

Khursheed thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
Zuhro was born in 1974. She is married and has four dependent children. Zuhro has had her own business for more than five years. Zuhro sells nuts at the local market. Her work day begins at 7 a.m. and continues until 5 p.m. 

Zuhro aims to foster a sense of well-being in her family. She is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy a refrigerator for her household. Her husband hasn't sent money for the last several months. She awaits your support and thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her household.

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham was born in 1972. She is married and lives in a rented house in a sector of Jordan called Wihdat. She lives with her husband who sells detergents. She is the mother of seven sons and daughters. 

Siham has been helping her husband financially by running a business selling blankets for the past three years. She started it with a small quantity of blankets. Now she needs to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of blankets and adding bed sheets and covers in order to increase her profits. However, she doesn’t have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets to sell.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
Amneh was born in 1960. She is married and lives in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla with her husband who works in agriculture with their three sons. 

Amneh has been helping her husband financially by running her project of selling blankets for two years. She started it with a small quantity. Now she needs to expand her project by purchasing a larger quantity of blankets in order to raise her profit. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de mecanica,el socio arregla carros y motos,el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de mecanica.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member, Abelardo, is still operating his auto mechanic shop, repairing cars and engines.  He works from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  He already has eight years in this business, and it is going very well.  His dream is to expand his auto repair business.  He is requesting the loan to purchase tires.  He is very grateful for the loan he has been given and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is from Plaridel and tends her own sari-sari store. She is 37 years old, and is raising her five children on her own. Through her store, she earns a meager income of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month, which supports her family's needs. Liezel has signed up for a membership to Paglaum MPC and applied for a loan of 15,000 PHP. She wants to restock her store's inventory but does not have enough means of her own to do it. 

Liezel wishes to save some of the increased profits to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to restock her inventory.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Sopheap is 28 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a singer for wedding parties. She makes an income of $2 per day. Her husband is a well digger who makes an income of $6 each day. Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income to financially support the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.en:
Abdujabbor is a young and smart man. He is married and lives with his wife in a rural area. Since 2009, Abdujabbor has been busy with animal husbandry. After graduating from school, he did not have the opportunity to pursue education at the university. 

In 2013, he entered the Polytechnic University of Tajikistan. Abdujabbor studies well. He must pay for his education, but he has no money. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa was born in 1980. She is married and a mother of four living in a sector in Jordan called Wihdat. Her husband is on duty serving with military. After Sharifa noticed the financial crisis her husband is facing, she decided to start running a mini market in front of her house where she has been selling food products for two years. 

Now she needs to buy a larger quantity of food products to expand her project and earn better profit in order to improve their living conditions and to provide her children with the best education. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food and other products to resell in her store.

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en:
Jocely, is 45 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She had three children and was happily married for five years. For those years of having a family, her fish lending was the only business where Jocely and her husband generated enough to live and survive in this world.
Jocely has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. With it, she asks for financial assistance from the institution for the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy "banyeras" (big basins) of fish to sell. Through it, she can have expand her business to nearby municipalities.

loans.use: to buy "banyeras" of fish to sell

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
Oun, age 64, is a widowed mother with no kids. She is a local borrower from Kandal Stoeng district in Kandal province. To provide her living, she has been planting rice and farming for 32 years. Her farming earned an income of 23,600 KHR per day.

Now she is the group leader of five, and they are seeking their first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she is going to use her entire loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her rice will gain a good crop yield for her to earn a profit to support her business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Suha was born in 1970. She is married and a mother of ten children who live in a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband works in agriculture. After Suha noticed the financial crisis her husband was facing, she decided to start running a mini market at her house where she has been selling food products for two years. 

Now Suha needs to buy a larger quantity of food products to improve their living conditions and to provide her children with the best education. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her mini market

loans.name: Judelyn

texts.en:
Judelyn and her husband are both farmers within their locality. The couple aim to improve their status of living to give their children a better future. 

Judelyn engages herself in buying and selling fruits and vegetables to generate additional income. To further improve her business involvement, she is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more stocks of ginger, taro, potatoes, and bananas to sell. She knows that her loan will be of great help in increasing her income and improving her living condition.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ginger, taro, potatoes, and bananas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university registration fees.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vidrios,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de vidrios.El socio solicita el credito para comprar vidrios.

El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member, Exaltación,  continues with his business, selling glass.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  He already has several years in this business and it is going very well.  His dream is to expand his business.  He is requesting the loan to purchase glass.  He is grateful for the loan he has been given, and promises to make the established payments.

loans.use: to purchase glass.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Because Ibtisam is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Ibtisam was born in 1972. She is living in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Karak with her husband and four daughters. Her husband is a retired man who currently owns a restaurant where he sells snacks, especially a traditional food called (Falafel). He started his project one year ago selling a few types of snacks. Then he started adding variety to them. Now he needs to purchase a new fryer and other tools, which will help him to be productive and do his work professionally in order to earn a better profit. But he doesn't have enough money to do so. Because of that, Ibtisam decided to help him by applying to this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a new fryer and other tools for her husband's restaurant

loans.name: José Rufino

texts.es:
Don José de 44 años de edad, solamente estudió tercer grado debido a la pobreza y que sus padres no vieron importante el estudio, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ellos y están estudiando, nadie mas vive con ellos. 


Él  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años, pues fue con sus padres que aprendió el trabajo y siempre le decía que era mejor aprender a trabajar que estudiar, además de la agricultura también es tractorista y eso lo aprendió de su papá, su día comienza a las 4:00 AM para prepararse e irse al trabajo de tractorista, donde trabaja 12 horas y regresa a las 6 de la tarde a su casa para descansar, cuando no hay trabajo con el tractor trabaja sembrando maíz y plátano.

El préstamo será utilizado, una parte para la siembra de maíz de regadío donde comprará semilla, abono y fertilizantes y la otra parte para cubrir unos gastos para el estudio de sus hijos.

Su sueño es que sus 2 hijos sean profesionales y espera que se gradúen de abogados. Con el préstamo logrará cubrir los gastos para insumos agrícolas y los gastos de estudio de sus hijos. Su sueño es dejarles un terreno a cada uno de sus hijos, además de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
José is 44 years old and only went as far as third grade in school due to poverty and the fact that his parents did not see education as important. He lives with his partner, who looks after the household chores. He has two children who live with them and are going to school; no one else lives with them. 

He has been farming for 10 years, and learned the work from his parents. They always said to him that it was better to learn to work than to go to school. 

In addition to farming, he is also a tractor operator, and learned this from his father. His day begins at 4:00 a.m. so that he can get ready and go to his tractor operator job, where he works 12 hours and returns home at 6 in the afternoon to rest. When there is no work with the tractor, he works growing corn and plantain. He will use part of the loan to grow irrigated corn, buying seed, manure and fertilizers; he will use the other part to cover some expenses for his children's education.

His dream is for his two children to be professionals, and hopes they graduate as lawyers. With the loan, he will manage to cover the expenses for agricultural supplies and the expenses for his children's education.  His dream is to leave a parcel of land to each one of his children, in addition to helping them with their university studies.

loans.use: To use one portion for growing irrigated corn, buying seed, manure and fertilizers, and the other portion to cover some expenses for his children's education.

loans.name: Rosmaida

texts.en:
Rosmaida is a housewife living with five persons in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is the main city in West Java located about a two to three hour drive from Jakarta. 

Rosmaida owns a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits and also services bill payments. For Rosmaida, doing business in selling mobile phone airtime with Ruma is pretty helpful, especially when she needs urgent cash to help her husband, who works in a private company. 

She felt interested in joining Ruma because of her friend's recommendation. For the last three months, she has had around $9 to $10 per day in sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more transactions on weekends. In the future, Rosmaida hopes that she will be able to improve her current business and seek more business opportunities. Rosmaida thanks you for your support.

In the photo, Rusmaida is standing in her stall called "warung", an Indonesian typical corner store.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To cover her daughter's school fees.

loans.name: Mahfurat

texts.en:
Mahfirat is a kind woman. She is 50 years old. Mahfirat is married and has three children. She has been busy with selling women's clothes more than 15 years. She sells in a local market. 

Mahfirat always wanted to offer her children higher education. Mahfirat’s daughter studies at the university. Mahfirat must pay for her tuition but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of $400 to pay for the education of her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is thankful for the financial assistance previously extended to her. She was able to buy the gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her income from business is assisting her to meet her family's everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time in the amount of 25,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials, like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer. She needs these items in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her to meet her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nida dreams that she will have an extension for her garden, and hopes that her family is always in good condition. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and from the Word of God.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy gardening materials, like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer, for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina engages herself in buying and selling root crops and vegetables. She has been doing this kind of business to help her husband in generating income. She is 35 years old and has three school age children. Despite the hardship of living, she aims to continue sending her children to school so they will become professionals in the future. 

With regards to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000.00 to buy more stocks of peanuts, taro, sweet potatoes, and squash to sell. Being a patient and industrious mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of peanuts, taro, sweet potatoes, and squash to sell

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
Marisa is 48 years old, married, and blessed with ten children. She is engaged in buying and selling fish and making fish paste (bagoong) in the community to support her family.

Marissa is now asking for financial support for an amount of PHP 5,000 to add to her capital.She will use her requested loan to buy additional fish to sell. She hopes for her loan to be approved so she can get better sales.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, vive junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo, posee un negocio de venta de conchas, ya cuenta con cuatro años de tenerlo, lo atiende de lunes a sábado, de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., no posee ayuda del extranjero.
Necita realizar la compra de conchas, para surtir el negocio y continuar ofreciendo productos de mejor calidad y frescos, espera que estas fechas sean de provecho para el negocio y sus ventas aumenten y así responder positivamente con sus compromisos.
Aspira a tener la posibilidad de comprar una lancha para mejorar sus economía y dar un  mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his life partner and their son. He has a business selling shellfish and has had it for four years already. He runs it from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. He has no help from outside the country.

He needs to purchase shellfish to supply the business and continue offering the freshest, best quality products. He hopes the coming days will be beneficial for his business and that his sales increase, enabling him to meet his commitments in a positive manner.

He hopes to have the chance to buy a small boat, in order to improve his finances and give his family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy shellfish.

loans.name: Chai's Group

texts.en:
Chai is aged 31 years old and married. She is a mother of three children. She lives in a rural area of the Tbaung Khmum district. To make a living, she and her husband have been working as a paid worker for a rubber factory. Together, they can earn about 30,000 KHR per day. 
Chai’s group consists of three members who live in the same area. She is in her fourth cycle with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Chai, who is the leader, will user her portion to buy household supplies and use a portion of it to spend on a decent motorbike. She hopes this loan will enable her to have enough household supplies and also have a proper motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy household supplies and a motorbike

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut, 30, lives in a rural area of the Srey Sonthor district of Kampong Cham province. She is married with two children. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming. To earn more income, her husband also sells grocery items. The current business earns her about US $13 per day to meet the family’s needs 

Mut has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan, which has helped her relieve her family's burden and improve their  livelihood. Now she is asking for a new loan to pay for her youngest brother’s tuition fees to study English Literature. She hopes that this loan will keep her youngest brother in the university.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s tuition fees

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra was born in the year 1970. She is a hard-working woman. Gulchehra has been busy selling milk products for more than 18 years. She sells milk, kefir, sour cream and butter. She has her own selling place. Gulchehra feeds milking cows. Her children help her with feeding the cows. 

Gulchehra’s husband is a builder. She lives with her family in a house which is in a bad condition. She is going to repair her house but she has not got the money. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy cement, wood and paint to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cement, wood and paint to repair her house.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: Josie grows hogs to sell as her business. Upon achieving the desired weight, she sells her hogs to butchers.This way, she earns PHP 3,000 per each hog. She has been in her business for a year now. Josie is 32 years old, married and has two children. She is now asking additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy sacks of feed and medicines for the hogs' sustenance. She hopes to keep growing healthy hogs to generate more good income.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and medicines for her hog raising business

loans.name: 02.04.8Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Lương is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. She operates a business selling fish.

Lương is 45 years old and she is married with two children.

She is the leader of an eight-member group, the 02.04.08 Đông Hải solidarity group.

One of her children is grown up so Lương lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Lương has been involved in this business for five years.

The main hardship that Lương faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lương hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Long's Group

texts.en:
Long is 32 years and single. He lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district earning a living through farming rice and also works as a worker to help earn income to support the family. He can earn about KHR 12,000 per day from the current business.
 
This is Long’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and he has been a member of VisionFund for two cycles. He successfully used the loans to better his living condition. Now he is leading his group to apply for a loan. Long will use his portion to harvest the paddy rice. He hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to harvesting the paddy rice.

loans.name: Krat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Krat is aged 59 years old and married. She and her husband have four children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and working for others for a fee. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 40,000 KHR per day to support her family.

This is the first loan for Krat with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to pay for harvesting fees. She hopes to have more crop yields and sell at a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a twenty-two-year-old coffee trader who is married and has one child. In addition to coffee trade, Alex also trades in gold which is sold on a small scale in his village and this boosts his incomes in a given period. He started the business in 2013 with high hopes that it would help him earn income which he would use to cater for the needs of his family. The business is located in a rural area in Bushenyi and his clients are mainly business men around the same area. 

He hopes to use the loan money to buy more stock so that he earns much more and boosts the business. His main challenge is lack of capital but he believes that this will no longer be a challenge if he gets the UGAFODE loan. He hopes to keep working hard so that he achieves his dreams in life which is the reason why he requested UGAFODE  to support him with a loan of eight hundred thousand shillings only.

loans.use: To buy coffee to sell.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea is a mother of three children, 42 years old, and a borrower from the Prey Chhor district in the Kampong Cham province. To provide for her family, she has been in rice and cassava farming, and worked as a paid worker for 17 years. She is a past client with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the second cycle for her with Vision Fund; the first time helped her to support the family on time. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her cassava will grow on time and provide her a good income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Rocio Imery

texts.es: Rocio de 20 años de edad es madre soltera y habita junto a su hijo y sus padres en casa familiar. Rocio trabaja muy duro junto a sus padres en un pequeño taller de carpintería que han logrado establecer en su hogar de habitación. Rocio enjunca, barniza y atornilla. Gracias a los buenos productos que ofrecen les ha permitido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día prefieren más sus productos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el negocio de carpintería en la compra de madera, junco, clavos, etc.
texts.en:
Rocio is 20 years old and a single mother. She lives with her son and her parents in the family home. Rocio works very hard alongside her parents, in a small carpentry workshop that they have managed to set up in their home. 

Rocio weaves cane, varnishes and assembles. Thanks to the fine products they offer, they have been able to earn the trust of many customers, who each day prefer their products more. 

She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the carpentry business, through the purchase of wood, cane and nails.

loans.use: To buy wood, cane, nails, etc.

loans.name: Riaz's Group

texts.en:
Riaz is a 40-year-old woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She looks after her family at home.  Her husband works in transportation, running an auto rickshaw for daily wages.  Due to high prices for maintaining their living standard, her husband didn't earn what the family requires. So her husband decided to buy his own auto rickshaw.  In this way he would be able to earn more income to fulfill his family requirements.  Her husband is an honest man in the society.

Riaz is already a BRAC borrower, so she made contact with the BRAC Pakistan office for loan purpose. BRAC staff physically visited her house and collected necessary information about her husband’s regularities.  BRAC Pakistan issued a loan for purchasing her husband's auto rickshaw.  She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, propane gas, and bags.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Sokhom, 26, is a married mother of two children. 

The sources of her family’s income are rice farming and selling fish. She and her husband have been in these businesses for several years. Sometimes, they also work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sokhom is just with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more fish to resell and use a portion of it to spend on harvesting rice. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Le, 43, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband started a food store many years ago. She sells beverages and cigarettes. She is requesting a loan to repair her scooter and buy a larger quantity of cigarettes to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair her scooter and buy cigarettes to sell.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en: Narciso is 36-years-old who cultivates a rice field.  He lives simply with his wife and three children.  He sacrifices his needs through working in the field because his family depends on him.  Narciso is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy four (4) bags of rice seeds, 24 bags of  fertilizers and six (6) liters of pesticides.  Having the additional capital he requested will be a great help in the improvement of his farming business.  He is sure to monitor and provide the needs of his crops to yield and harvest better crops in the next cropping season. Through this, he would be able to secure his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of rice seeds, 24 bags of  fertilizers and 6 liters of pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jackson, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Noemi maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Noemi dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy herbicides, pesticides, seed, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed for her little piglets.

loans.name: Sengkong

texts.en:
Sengkong, aged 50, is a humble man and a father of two. He lives with his wife and children in their own home in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To earn a living, he and his wife have a rice farm on one hectare of land. Despite their hardships, they aim to give their children a better life and the opportunities of education.

Sengkong would like to borrow $500 to drill a well in his yard, because he wants to ensure he has enough water for his family both in the rainy season and dry season. This way they will not face a water shortage and will not need to spend time collecting water from far away. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Sengkong will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to drill a well in his yard.

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie, 25 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has operated a food vending business for almost one year, earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her profits are usually spent on school allowances for her children. Due to lack of capital, Stephanie would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase vegetables and frozen foods to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and frozen foods to sell.
